  • Have 10+ years of product design experience, with deep experience working on complex B2B and B2C SaaS products and 3+ years of successfully building and managing design teams.

  • Evidence of getting into the details to uphold a high standard of B2B design quality (UX and UI) and craftsmanship in your team’s work.

  • Proven track record of producing designs that impact the business – by digging in yourself, leading through others, and influencing internal stakeholders.

  • Deep experience partnering well with product management and engineering counterparts.

  • Passion for leading, coaching, and building an inspired team through setting vision, unlocking potential, and driving compassionate accountability. Ability to establish a vibrant, opinionated, and inclusive design culture. 

  • Deep curiosity about AI and cybersecurity. Prior experience in security is helpful but not required. We’ve found that leaders with strong design skills in technically complex areas can bring fresh perspectives to create great experiences for our users.

  • As part of the interview, we require a portfolio that demonstrates work produced by your teams that has impacted the business, and operational practices you have implemented which have led to a higher functioning team.

  • Industry-competitive salary and equity

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer, GRC
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Senior Product Designer at Vanta, you’ll drive user-centric projects in a rapidly scaling company trusted by hundreds of organizations to protect their most critical data. You’ll work closely with Engineering and Product Managers to create interfaces that bring clarity to complex workflows. Joining Vanta’s growing design team means driving high-impact changes to our product, and playing a key role in shaping our team’s design culture.


You will report to our Director of Design within the Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) Product Pillar. You will be working with a squad that’s focused on helping customers support multiple frameworks (SOC 2, HIPAA, GDPR, etc.) at the same time, and helping customers adopt new frameworks . You will also have the opportunity to develop AI-first features that help our customers manage their compliance programs.

What you’ll do as a Senior Product Designer at Vanta:

  • Bring a high standard of visual and interaction design to your work, ensuring our users have intuitive, delightful experiences.

  • Develop a deep understanding of our users and craft thoughtful designs that meet their needs.

  • Work closely with subject matter experts, and partner with them to create guidelines that improve user content and user guidance within Vanta.

  • Iterate on design solutions based on user feedback, data insights, and collaboration with the team.

  • Use system thinking to create cohesive user experiences, considering how design patterns and components are used consistently across Vanta.

  • Dive into Vanta's broader ecosystem, learning from other designers and contributing to how different areas of our product connect and interact.

  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, from engineers to product managers, to bring designs to life and ensure seamless implementation.

  • Communicate design rationale effectively to stakeholders, building alignment and enthusiasm for your ideas.

  • Lead by example and provide mentorship to junior designers, helping them grow their skills and understanding of design best practices.

How to be successful in this role:

  • 6+ years of experience as a Product Designer, with some experience in B2B SaaS or other complex domains

  • Strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in UI/UX design, and system thinking, and high visual craftsmanship.

  • Proven experience in creating inclusive and accessible design solutions.

  • Expertise in Figma, including auto-layout, properties, and variables.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

  • Strong communication and presentation skills.

  • Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.

  • Experience in developing comprehensive documentation for design components.

  • Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor other designers.

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

As the category leader in compliance and security automation, we’re capturing market share rapidly, and our Sales team is at the forefront of that charge.

To support this continued growth, we’re expanding our Startups Sales team. We’re looking for high-energy, customer-focused Account Executives who thrive in high-volume, fast-paced environments and are motivated by the challenge of turning velocity into results. In this role, you’ll take full ownership of the sales cycle—from first touch to close—and play a critical role in positioning Vanta as the go-to solution for early-stage companies navigating security and compliance for the first time.

This is a highly transactional, new business role where success comes from running a tight, repeatable process and maintaining a high daily output.

If you love the energy of working with startups, are driven to outperform targets, and want to make a tangible impact in a rapidly scaling business, we’d love to hear from you.

This role will be based in our Dublin office with an office-centric hybrid schedule. The standard in-office days are Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday.

What you’ll do as an Account Executive, Startups - EMEA at Vanta:

  • Identify high-potential business verticals to develop and execute outbound strategies to engage them with Vanta.

  • Manage the entire sales cycle, from initial contact to contract negotiation and closing, with a focus on speed and efficiency, aiming to close deals within a 30-day timeframe.

  • Turn our inbound demand into closed-won business quickly and consistently, working across a large number of prospects

  • Operate in a fast-paced, transactional sales environment, running a high number of discovery calls and managing a broad pipeline of opportunities simultaneously.

  • Continuously optimize your sales workflow to maintain high activity levels, improve conversion, and deliver repeatable results.

  • Define and communicate the value of Vanta to prospects, including tailoring sales materials and demos to resonate with early-stage startup buyers

  • Surface product feedback and trends from prospects to inform go-to-market and product development strategies.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have 12+ months in a closing and quota-carrying role, while consistently exceeding monthly and quarterly sales targets

  • Experience in B2B SaaS, ideally focused on SMB or early-stage startups, where short deal cycles and high activity are the norm

  • Thrive in high-velocity sales environments and are energized by repetition, fast decision-making, and a transactional approach to deal flow

  • Be highly empathetic to customers, with a proven track record of long-term customer retention.

  • Possess the technical competency to understand Vanta’s software and build great relationships with highly technical prospects.

  • Have stellar problem-solving chops, and an enthusiasm for making a large impact early on at a start-up.

  • You’re intrinsically motivated, proactive, and resourceful—comfortable taking initiative without needing direction

  • Industry-competitive salary and equity

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks paid parental leave for all new parents (birthing, non-birthing, and adoptive)

  • Health & wellness stipend

  • Remote workspace,internet and mobile phone stipend

  • Commuter benefits, including bike to work scheme and tax commuter ticket scheme

  • Pension matching

jobs.title: Campaign Operations Manager, Email Infrastructure
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Campaign Operations Manager, you will be the bridge between our marketing strategy and flawless email execution. You will own the email infrastructure that turns marketing strategy into scalable campaigns, ensuring deliverability, data integrity and automation.

The Marketing Operations team at Vanta ensures that systems, processes and data are in place for marketing to run efficiently. The Campaign Operations Manager will ensure that email campaigns are executed reliably, at scale, and with full compliance. The Campaign Operations Manager’s work directly supports our team’s goals of building efficient systems, enabling flawless execution, and driving measurable pipeline impact. This person will help optimize campaign speed and accuracy, maintain data and attribution integrity, and build the infrastructure that powers our global email program.

What you’ll do as a Campaign Operations Manager at Vanta:

  • Own and manage email sending infrastructure across our MAP, including authentication, dedicated IPs, and send configurations. You will monitor deliverability health and sender reputation. You will partner with internal teams to troubleshoot and flag domain issues and performance degradation

  • Set up scalable playbooks and workflows that can be reused across programs and teams

  • Build and manage automated email workflows for lifecycle, lead nurture, and re-engagement programs. Ensure that these workflows align with lead scoring models, lifecycle stages and sales processes

  • Partner with the analytics team to ensure all email programs are correctly tagged. Use performance insights to drive ongoing betterments

  • Own the design and maintenance of email subscription management. Lead email compliance across all regions

How to be successful in this role:

  • You have a strong understanding of email deliverability best practices, including inbox placement, sender reputation, bounce management, and spam compliance

  • You have experience managing domain authentication protocols and dedicated sending domains/subdomains

  • You have demonstrated experience working with Hubspot/Marketo to build global campaign templates, personalized email, and dynamic content

  • You are able to build, manage, and troubleshoot email workflows, understand how leads flow between MAP and CRM, and can resolve sync issues or logic errors

  • You are experienced in implementing opt-in workflows, handling regional compliance, and managing preference centers

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

As the Director of Technical Recruiting, you’ll help to drive all hiring across all Engineering, Product, Design, and Security roles globally at Vanta. You’ll directly manage a team of technical sourcers, recruiters, and two managers and report to the Head of Talent Acquisition. This team plays a critical role in ensuring we attract, assess, and hire top technical talent to enable Vanta to continue to successfully grow.

  • Build, develop, and innovate unique strategies to ensure all technical recruiting functions are able to hit quarterly hiring goals.

  • Diagnose and solve problems or bottlenecks in the hiring funnels with your team.

  • Monitor and report on key metrics to stakeholders and Vanta’s leadership team.

  • Manage a small req load (likely focused on key EPD leadership hires).

You’ll be joining a team that is building and scaling our upmarket motion, and you’ll help shape Vanta’s strategy and execution in some of our most strategic segments. Success in this role means driving full-cycle deals from prospecting through close—both directly and through partners.

  • Work closely with legal, product, engineering, solution engineers, and GRC specialists throughout the deal cycle

  • Leverage and contribute to building the enterprise playbook, refining our GTM approach as we scale

  • Provide accurate forecasts and deliver consistently against quota

  • 7+ years in a closing Account Executive role, with at least 5 years selling enterprise B2B SaaS

  • Proven ability to consistently meet/exceed quota, including managing 5+ six-figure deals per quarter

  • Strong outbound prospecting skills and ability to independently build a robust pipeline

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Data Platform
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Senior Manager, Data Platform you’ll be responsible for laying the foundation for a best-in-class analytics function. You’ll partner closely with our engineering team and business stakeholders to ensure that our analytics stack and processes meet the business needs today with an eye towards the future.

What you’ll do as a Senior Manager, Data Platform at Vanta:

  • Roadmap and evolve the architecture of Vanta’s Snowflake‑based data warehouse, ensuring it scales to support real‑time analytics, zero‑trust principles, and FedRAMP‑capable compliance requirements

  • Hire, train, and develop a world‑class team of data engineers and analytics engineers, providing hands-on mentorship and creating a culture of excellence and continuous learning. Establish the two respective functions as a collaborative set of teams

  • Champion a security, compliance, and privacy‑first mindset across data ingestion, storage, transformation, access, and observability

  • Deliver a “zero‑trust” data warehouse by implementing role‑based access controls, column‑level encryption, detailed audit logging, and automated policy enforcement

  • Collaborate with AI, Strategic Finance, Revenue Operations, Data Science, Product Analytics, and Engineering to translate business objectives into a prioritized, measurable data platform roadmap

  • Own buy‑versus‑build decisions for the data stack; evaluate vendors, negotiate contracts with procurement, and integrate best‑in‑class solutions where they accelerate our mission. Hold and measure your platform decisions to a high data platform ROI solution

  • Be Vanta’s authoritative voice on dbt, change‑data‑capture (CDC), data orchestration patterns (Airflow/Dagster), and high‑performance database design

  • Oversee the Architecture to Design and implement complex data models, metadata layers, reports, and dashboards that power internal decision‑making and customer‑facing analytics

  • Develop front‑end applications and APIs that expose curated analytical data sets across the enterprise

  • Develop Data Platform Application training, access patterns and enablement that internal customers consider “awesome”, and that you measure and hold your team to the highest standards delivering

  • Contribute to data governance frameworks that guarantee data quality, availability, and discoverability

How to be successful in this role:

  • 12+ years working with data, including 5+ years architecting and operating Snowflake at scale, plus 2+ years of hands‑on software engineering experience

  • Demonstrated expertise in data storage strategies, CDC pipelines, database & BI architecture, and modern data orchestration patterns

  • Proven success building secure, privacy‑aware, compliant data platforms (SOC 2, HIPAA, ISO 27001; FedRAMP experience a major plus)

  • 4+ years Experience managing, mentoring and developing data engineers and analytics engineers; comfortable managing a 5-6 person team with multiple functions (ingestion / bi) with plans to scale

  • System‑oriented mindset— you automate, abstract, and write maintainable, tested code.

  • Hands‑on proficiency with the modern data stack: Snowflake, dbt, Airflow/Dagster, Fivetran/Stitch, Looker/Mode/Sigma

  • Strong communication skills; able to translate deep technical detail into crisp narratives for executives and cross‑functional partners

  • Adept at making pragmatic buy/build decisions and guiding organizations through platform migrations

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney

We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. jobs.title: Manager, Technical Sourcing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As the Manager of Technical Sourcing, you’ll be responsible for building and leading a high-performing team of technical sourcers focused on identifying and engaging global engineering talent across Engineering, Product, Design, and Security. This is a high-impact, strategic role where you’ll partner closely with recruiting leadership and engineering leaders to build proactive, scalable talent strategies that directly shape the trajectory of the business.

At our core, we believe that sourcing is not a stepping stone to recruiting; it is a distinct, critical discipline that demands its own expertise, rigor, and excellence. Exceptional organizations are built on exceptional talent and sourcing plays a pivotal role in uncovering, understanding, and engaging the game-changing individuals who can redefine what's possible.

We’re looking for a sourcing leader who shares this belief. Someone who can lead with vision, execute with precision, and elevate the function as a true strategic partner to the business.

What you’ll do as a Sourcing Manager at Vanta:

  • Build and Lead the Sourcing Function: Establish and scale our engineering sourcing team, defining best practices, workflows, tools, and metrics.

  • Team Development: Hire, coach, mentor, and manage a team of technical sourcers. Create career development plans and foster a culture of excellence and collaboration.

  • Strategic Talent Mapping: Drive market research and talent intelligence initiatives to identify critical skill gaps, talent clusters, and emerging trends.

  • Pipeline Ownership: Build and maintain strategic talent pipelines for high-priority engineering roles across software, infrastructure, and security.

  • Partnership with Engineering: Collaborate with engineering and product leadership to understand team needs and deliver sourcing strategies aligned to business goals.

  • Data-Driven Decisions: Use data and sourcing analytics to continuously improve pipeline quality, outreach effectiveness, and team performance.

  • Employer Brand Activation: Partner with marketing and recruiting to position our company as an employer of choice in niche engineering markets.

As an SEO Manager at Vanta, you’ll play a vital role in developing, executing, and scaling our SEO program. Reporting to the Senior SEO Manager on the Web team, you’ll partner with PMM, Content, Comms and Brand studio to execute on projects that boost Vanta’s search visibility across search engines and LLMs. The ultimate goal of the SEO program is to contribute to pipeline generation.

What you’ll do as a SEO Manager at Vanta:

  • Help lead and implement comprehensive SEO and AEO strategies that increase organic traffic, brand visibility, and drive pipeline.

  • Research, architect, and orchestrate ICP-centric content experiences—blog posts, content hubs, resources, and more—that engage and convert.

  • Collaborate with PMM, Content, and security/compliance subject-matter experts to build and execute a SEO editorial roadmap aligned with product and messaging priorities.

  • Create and manage a backlog of experiments and optimizations (FAQs, content layout tweaks, video integration, CTAs, schema markup, and more).

  • Partner with Comms and external agencies on digital-PR initiatives that earn authoritative backlinks and brand mentions to amplify our brand search visibility.

  • Monitor and evaluate SEO performance, report on key metrics, and refine tactics based on insights.

How to be successful in this role:

  • You have 3-5+ years of SEO experience–preferably in a high-growth enterprise SaaS business–with a record of delivering measurable growth.

  • Proficiency in SEO tools, such as GA4, Google Search Console, SEMRush, Ahrefs, Sitebulb, etc.

  • You are leveraging AI in your daily workflows to amplify your impact and output

  • You think like both a content strategist and engineer, balancing big-picture planning and refinement of defensible content systems.

  • You are excited about optimizing for LLMs and adapting to the new zero-click paradigm.

  • Have 3-5 years of sales experience, with at least 2+ years of management/leadership experience 

  • Offer experience in B2B SaaS sales and sales management

As Vanta’s Compensation Manager, you’ll provide critical analytical and operational support to our Director of Compensation. You’ll help ensure that Vanta’s compensation processes run smoothly today while building the foundation to scale the function effectively as the company grows. This role is highly execution- and data-focused, playing a key part in supporting our day-to-day compensation transactions and driving the analyses that inform changes to our compensation programs and philosophy.

You’ll partner closely with our Finance team and People Business Partners to align compensation decisions with budgetary planning and workforce strategy. You’ll also manage key systems such as Carta (our equity platform) and Pave (our compensation benchmarking tool), and build equity burn models that help us manage dilution and cost as we scale. Over time, this role will also flex into people analytics, helping to build dashboards and deliver workforce insights that inform broader People team decisions and support the evolution of a scalable, data-driven People function.

This role reports to Vanta’s Director of Compensation.

What you’ll do as a Compensation Manager at Vanta:

  • Partner closely with the Director of Compensation to execute and scale Vanta’s compensation processes, including salary and equity reviews, job benchmarking, and compensation band updates

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Finance on budgeting, headcount planning, and equity pool management, and with People Business Partners on compensation decisions for hiring, promotions, and internal mobility

  • Build and maintain equity burn models to forecast and monitor dilution and total cost of ownership as the company grows

  • Manage and optimize our compensation and equity systems, including Pave and Carta, ensuring data integrity, consistency, and scalability

  • Conduct compensation data analysis and modeling to support decisions during compensation cycles and changes to our programs, with a focus on sustainable growth

  • Own and improve daily compensation operations—such as new hire offers and internal transfers—with a view toward automating and standardizing them to support a larger, global team over time

  • Support the evolution of our compensation infrastructure by helping to implement new tools, workflows, and reporting capabilities that grow with the business

  • Build dashboards and reports that support people analytics use cases and deliver insights across the People team and business, laying the groundwork for a scalable analytics function

  • Support compensation-related audits and compliance initiatives, helping ensure our compensation practices remain both competitive and consistent as we expand

How to be successful in this role:

  • 4+ years of experience in compensation, people analytics, or a related field

  • Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills with experience building, maintaining, and simplifying compensation and equity models

  • Familiarity with compensation survey data (e.g., Radford, Pave) and job leveling frameworks

  • Experience using and managing compensation and equity platforms, particularly Carta and Pave

  • Strong attention to detail and a process-oriented mindset, with a focus on designing systems that scale

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to convey complex data insights clearly to stakeholders

  • Comfort working with confidential data and handling sensitive issues with discretion

  • Experience with data visualization tools, dashboard platforms or basic SQL (e.g., Looker, Tableau, or Google Data Studio) is a plus

  • Prior experience in high-growth or pre-IPO environments is helpful, especially where compensation infrastructure needed to scale rapidly

This role is highly execution- and data-focused, playing a key part in supporting our day-to-day compensation transactions and driving the analyses that inform changes to our compensation programs and philosophy.

You’ll partner closely with our Finance team and People Business Partners to align compensation decisions with budgetary planning and workforce strategy. You’ll also manage key systems such as Carta (our equity platform) and Pave (our compensation benchmarking tool), and build equity burn models that help us manage dilution and cost as we scale. Over time, this role will also flex into people analytics, helping to build dashboards and deliver workforce insights that inform broader People team decisions and support the evolution of a scalable, data-driven People function.

This role reports to Vanta’s Director of Compensation.

What you’ll do as a Compensation Manager at Vanta:

 - Partner closely with the Director of Compensation to execute and scale Vanta’s compensation processes, including salary and equity reviews, job benchmarking, and compensation band updates

 - Collaborate cross-functionally with Finance on budgeting, headcount planning, and equity pool management, and with People Business Partners on compensation decisions for hiring, promotions, and internal mobility

 - Build and maintain equity burn models to forecast and monitor dilution and total cost of ownership as the company grows

 - Manage and optimize our compensation and equity systems, including Pave and Carta, ensuring data integrity, consistency, and scalability

 - Conduct compensation data analysis and modeling to support decisions during compensation cycles and changes to our programs, with a focus on sustainable growth

 - Own and improve daily compensation operations—such as new hire offers and internal transfers—with a view toward automating and standardizing them to support a larger, global team over time

 - Support the evolution of our compensation infrastructure by helping to implement new tools, workflows, and reporting capabilities that grow with the business

 - Build dashboards and reports that support people analytics use cases and deliver insights across the People team and business, laying the groundwork for a scalable analytics function

 - Support compensation-related audits and compliance initiatives, helping ensure our compensation practices remain both competitive and consistent as we expand

How to be successful in this role:

 - 4+ years of experience in compensation, people analytics, or a related field

 - Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills with experience building, maintaining, and simplifying compensation and equity models

 - Familiarity with compensation survey data (e.g., Radford, Pave) and job leveling frameworks

 - Experience using and managing compensation and equity platforms, particularly Carta and Pave

 - Strong attention to detail and a process-oriented mindset, with a focus on designing systems that scale

 - Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to convey complex data insights clearly to stakeholders

 - Comfort working with confidential data and handling sensitive issues with discretion

 - Experience with data visualization tools, dashboard platforms or basic SQL (e.g., Looker, Tableau, or Google Data Studio) is a plus

 - Prior experience in high-growth or pre-IPO environments is helpful, especially where compensation infrastructure needed to scale rapidly

What you can expect as a Vantan:

 - Industry-competitive compensation

 - 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

 - 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

 - Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

 - Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

 - 401(k) matching

 - Flexible work hours and location

 - Open PTO policy

 - 11 paid holidays in the US

 - Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney

To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors and may vary based on candidate location, skills, depth of work experience, and relevant licenses/credentials.

As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage and welcome people of all backgrounds to apply.

About Vanta

We started in 2018, in the wake of several high-profile data breaches. Online security was only becoming more important, but we knew firsthand how hard it could be for fast-growing companies to invest the time and manpower it takes to build a solid security foundation. Vanta was inspired by a vision to restore trust in internet businesses by enabling companies to improve and prove their security. From our early days automating security monitoring for compliance standards like SOC 2, HIPAA and ISO 27001 to creating the world's leading Trust Management Platform, our vision remains unchanged. 

Now more than ever, making security continuous—not just a point-in-time check— is essential. Thousands of companies rely on Vanta to build, maintain and demonstrate their trust— all in a way that's real-time and transparent.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

The Foundations team sits at the heart of Vanta’s architecture and is critical to unlocking current and future Vanta products. We fetch, process, and serve the core resource and evidence data that powers Vanta. As a member of this team, you’ll work on the source-of-truth systems that enable core Vanta compliance and auditing experiences.

We’re looking for a senior backend engineer who thrives on shipping quickly, solving real customer problems, and building reliable systems that scale.

Visit our Vanta Engineering Blog to learn more about what our team is working on! 

What you’ll do as a Senior Software Engineer at Vanta:

  • Improve the scalability and reliability of our core data systems, ensuring they’re robust in the face of growth.

  • Help define and evolve how we model, store, and query resource data across Vanta.

  • Collaborate with product, design, and other engineering teams to understand user needs and prioritize impactful work.

  • Ship quickly and experiment thoughtfully to validate ideas and drive product velocity.

  • Act as a cultural beacon, setting an example for effective, collaborative engineering and helping mentor junior team members

  • Make effective tradeoffs that consider business priorities, user experience, and a sustainable technical foundation

  • Drive initiatives to increase operational posture and execution quality across the engineering organization

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have 5+ years of experience

  • Be comfortable operating robust distributed systems and navigating scaling challenges. Have familiarity with event-driven architecture.

  • Care deeply about understanding and solving customer problems.

  • Work well in environments that value decisive action and getting things done, and bias towards shipping quickly to validate ideas and experiment rather than building a perfect solution.

You will work closely with engineering leadership and product teams to ensure the alignment of systems with Vanta’s technical strategy, and you will actively influence key decisions across the organization.

What you’ll do as a Staff Software Engineer on Design Systems at Vanta:

  • Be a leader for and advise on UI/UX best practices and standards at Vanta bringing a high bar for design craft ensuring our components are both functional and refined

  • Build, maintain, and update existing shared UI components to ensure they are consistent across our system and product, bug free, well tested, and well documented.

  • Address product, technical, and operational challenges with clear, impactful solutions.

  • Serve as a cultural leader, modeling collaborative behaviors and mentoring engineers to elevate organizational performance.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Over 9 years of industry experience with deep expertise in one or more technical areas (e.g., frontend, design systems, accessibility, app performance, runtime).

  • Proven ability to lead complex technical initiatives, driving strategic projects and improving organizational processes in fast-paced, dynamic environments.

  • Mastery in system design and software architecture, with an emphasis on user experience and accessibility standards, and a strong sense of design craft.

  • Extensive experience building tooling and abstractions for developers that result in user-facing experiences.

  • Expertise in debugging and supporting platform tooling for the frontend.

  • Design, develop, and own new product functionality and infrastructure leveraging modern frameworks and tooling (TypeScript, Terraform, Node.js)

Vanta’s team and technology surface are growing quickly, and it’s essential that we invest in the right abstractions and systems to enable us to scale with our business. As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll be responsible for setting technical direction to enable our product and infrastructure to scale with our business, driving complex projects across our technical stack, and mentoring our talented engineering team. Your past experience will be leveraged to enable and accelerate Vanta’s growth.

Our business has found incredible product-market fit and has monetized effectively since the day we signed our first customer. We’re growing at a blistering pace, which presents career-defining opportunities for engineers to accelerate their growth and to contribute to a rapidly-scaling company.

Visit our Vanta Engineering Blog to learn more about what our team is working on!

  • Lead complex projects with multiple stakeholders and engineers to deliver significant impact to our business

  • Set direction for critical technical surface areas, enabling us to stay ahead of continued rapid growth

  • Design, develop, and own new product functionality and/or infrastructure leveraging modern frameworks and tooling (TypeScript, React, Node.js)

  • Work with talented and kind engineers to make a significant impact on our customer base, enabling them to improve their security and prove it

  • Contribute to building Vanta’s engineering culture as we grow

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have at least 5 years of industry experience

  • Have played technical leadership roles for teams or complex projects

  • Have previous startup experience, or worked in an environment that prioritizes a bias for action

  • Have previous experience working on greenfield projects

  • Have an interest in learning about security or prior experience in the space

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager, Enterprise
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As Vanta’s Customer Success Manager, Enterprise, you will play a pivotal role in guiding customers through their security and compliance journeys with Vanta's specialized solutions. By combining your customer-centric approach with expertise in Vanta's products and security best practices, you will contribute to the overall success and satisfaction of Vanta's customers in achieving robust security and compliance outcomes through retention of customers and health of the book of business.

 

Vanta’s success over the last year was exponential and we are now working to solve the problem of how to provide world-class customer experience to as many security-minded software companies as possible. As Vanta’s Enterprise Customer Success Manager, you will be the voice of Vanta, responsible for helping keep our customers moving toward their goals and ultimately successful and happy. 

What you’ll do as a Customer Success Manager, Enterprise at Vanta:

  • Lead all post sales activities for Vanta's enterprise customers by guiding them through onboarding, implementation, product adoption, value-driven renewals and identifying upsells.

  • Partner with Account Managers to drive renewal and expansion opportunities within your book of business

  • Become a product expert on Vanta and how our platform can be used to improve security posture through our compliance offerings (SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR, HIPAA, USDP and Custom Frameworks), Trust Reports, and Risk Management solution.

  • Guide implementation, configuration, and optimization of Vanta Trust Management Platform

  • Managing 40 Enterprise customers ($3M ARR in BoB)

  • Provide professional advice on security best practices and compliance standards

  • Collaborate with the customer to optimize security program and Identify areas of improvement. Act as voice of the customer within Vanta

  • Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key accounts, customer stakeholders, and executive sponsors that may lead to renewals, expansion, and advocacy.

  • Work cross-functionally to resolve customer business issues and work toward mutual goals.

How to be successful in this role:

  • 8+ years of experience as a Customer Success Manager for a SaaS company

  • Managing a book of business of Enterprise 

  • Experience handling onboarding, implementation, adoption, identifying opportunities for expansion

  • Experience in audit (internal or external), risk management, compliance, or GRC frameworks/tools, with a focus on tackling enterprise-level challenges and creating measurable value for customers (preferred).

  • Self-starter, able to work with little or no supervision

  • Possess clear and thoughtful communication skills, with strong critical thinking ability. 

  • Be highly empathetic to customers, with a proven track record of long-term customer retention.

  • Experience with hitting retention targets and creating happy, healthy customers

  • Possess the technical competency to understand Vanta’s software and build great relationships with highly technical customers.

  • Have stellar problem-solving chops, and an enthusiasm for making a large impact early on at a start-up.

  • Extensive experience with high-end exposure to C-level executives, and the ability to build strong trusted relationships 

  • Providing top-notch account management and relationship building through various means; Quarterly Business Reviews, Health Check Ins, and Executive summaries etc

  • Ability to be nimble and agile in an environment where shifting priorities should be expected

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, Dublin, and Sydney

As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage and welcome people of all backgrounds to apply.

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Credit & Collections
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

At Vanta, we’re scaling fast—and we’re building a finance team that can scale with us. As we grow and evolve, we’re tackling increasingly complex and exciting accounting challenges. If you’re a detail-oriented, systems-savvy accounting professional who thrives in dynamic environments and wants to help shape the future of a rapidly growing company, we’d love to meet you.

As our Senior Manager of Credit & Collections, you’ll lead and mentor a team of AR collection specialists while owning the end to end collections strategy for a global and growing customer base. You’ll oversee timely and accurate collections across segments, design scalable processes and build reporting to drive visibility to DSO, aging, and risk exposure. This role is a unique opportunity to shape the collections function, reduce risk, and contribute directly to healthy cash flow and sustainable growth.

But that’s just part of the job.

Beyond that, you’ll also drive tooling improvements, implement strong internal controls, and support audit readiness to ensure compliance with accounting standards and company policies. You'll work cross-functionally with Sales, Account Management, Customer Success and Legal, helping to bridge accounting rigor with operational excellence.

What you’ll do as a Senior Manager of Collections at Vanta:

  • Lead, mentor, and develop a team of AR Collection specialists, setting clear performance goals and delegating tasks effectively to ensure productive workflow.

  • Oversee timely and accurate collections of invoices from customers across all segments, tailoring collection strategies for each segment

  • Define, document, and implement end-to-end collections processes to support a growing and global customer base

  • Analyze AR Aging report, subscription accounts, and outstanding invoices to proactively identify high-risk accounts to prevent collections issues

  • Negotiate payment plans and settlements as necessary while ensuring a high level of customer service through our internal collections process

  • Collaborate with Sales, Account Management, Customer Success and Legal to address AR-related issues and improve customer satisfaction

  • Build reporting and dashboards to monitor collections performance, DSO, and aging metrics

  • Oversee AR tooling and implementation to ensure data integrity and proactively identify opportunities to streamline processes

  • Partner with Revenue Accounting to ensure proper revenue recognition, bad debt provisioning, and audit readiness

  • Design and implement internal controls to ensure collections activities comply with accounting standards, company policies, and regulatory requirements.

  • Assess with external audits related to AR to ensure compliance with company polices, relevant compliance regulations and internal controls

How to be successful in this role:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field

  • 7+ years of AR or collections with at least 3 years in management or supervisory role.

  • Proven track record of successfully managing AR and collections, preferably within the SaaS industry

  • Strong understanding of U.S. GAAP, particularly AR best practices.

  • Experience working in a high-growth or fast-paced environment.

  • Strong attention to detail, analytical skills, and comfort working in systems such as NetSuite, or similar ERP platforms.

  • Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills

  • Self-starter with a collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment with competing priorities.

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney

To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. jobs.title: Staff Product Manager - Cloud & Security
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Product Manager at Vanta, you will be responsible for the overall efficacy and impact of the product features in your area of responsibility. Specifically, that means that you will own the customer voice for your product area, and therefore will be the decision maker for prioritization for your cross-functional team of designers and engineers. You’ll also be responsible for collaborating more broadly with cross-departmental partners like Sales, Marketing and Customer Service to deeply serve customers throughout their Vanta journey.

You’ll lead the Cloud, Code, and Security product team at Vanta, which supports compliance-related security outcomes for our customers. You will help support our customers integrations to cloud, version control, and security-related tools, own cloud and security related experiences including tests and product pages, and take on the strategy for our future security offerings.

What you’ll do as a Staff Product Manager at Vanta:

  • Deeply understand our customers and our market

  • Distill complex problems and opportunities into clearly prioritized product goals, focus for your team, and high-quality execution in collaboration with stakeholders across the company

  • Deliver a high quality product addressing key customer pain points and creating opportunities for competitive advantage

  • Help to define and shape Vanta's product team culture as we grow

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have 10+ years of product management experience, with a proven track record for delivering high-quality products to customers

  • Have clear prior experience working with cloud or cybersecurity products. You should feel comfortable speaking the language of cloud and security, and have past experience leading teams building cloud-related or security-related features such as cloud integrations, proactive/reactive security tooling, or SIEM

  • Possess a customer-focused mindset, proactively reaching out to customers and prospects, while simultaneously partnering with go-to-market teams

  • Ability to see how various products and features should fit together to serve different user groups, with the analytical skills to justify the approach being taken

  • Be deeply curious, empathetic, and user-centric, with a knack for driving effective collaboration amongst your stakeholders

  • Have the ability to bring a product roadmap to life through consistent execution and project management

  • Excellent communication both written and verbal, to effectively communicate ideas and requirements to team members, stakeholders, and executives

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney

To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors and may vary based on candidate location, skills, depth of work experience, and relevant licenses/credentials.

#LI-remote

At Vanta, we are committed to hiring diverse talent of different backgrounds and as such, it is important to us to provide an inclusive work environment for all. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender identity, age, religion, sexual orientation, veteran or disability status, or any other protected class. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage and welcome people of all backgrounds to apply.

About Vanta

We started in 2018, in the wake of several high-profile data breaches. Online security was only becoming more important, but we knew firsthand how hard it could be for fast-growing companies to invest the time and manpower it takes to build a solid security foundation. Vanta was inspired by a vision to restore trust in internet businesses by enabling companies to improve and prove their security. From our early days automating security monitoring for compliance standards like SOC 2, HIPAA and ISO 27001 to creating the world's leading Trust Management Platform, our vision remains unchanged. 

Now more than ever, making security continuous—not just a point-in-time check— is essential. Thousands of companies rely on Vanta to build, maintain and demonstrate their trust— all in a way that's real-time and transparent.

jobs.title: DACH Customer Success Manager, SMB
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Vanta Customer Success Manager you will play a pivotal role in guiding customers through their security and compliance journeys with Vanta's specialized solutions. By combining your customer-centric approach with expertise in Vanta's products and security best practices, you will contribute to the overall success and satisfaction of Vanta's customers in achieving robust security and compliance outcomes through retention of customers and health of the book of business.

Vanta’s success over the last year was exponential and we are now working to solve the problem of how to provide world-class customer experience to as many security-minded software companies as possible. As a Vanta Customer Success Manager, you will be the voice of Vanta, responsible for helping keep our customers moving toward their goals and ultimately successful and happy.

This role is hybrid in our London office 3 days per week and is not eligible for remote work at this time.

What you’ll do as a Customer Success Manager at Vanta:

  • Guide our customers in our Growth segment through onboarding, implementation, product adoption, and value-driven success.

  • Work with Vanta customers across industries, functions, and stages of their customer journey in a strategic manner.

  • Proactively partner with Account Managers by flagging at-risk accounts, providing customer insights, and highlighting expansion opportunities

  • Empower customers to become self-sufficient Vanta champions, solving their immediate needs while focusing on their long-term success, value realization, and retention.

  • Monitor and prioritize your book of business based on key indicators of customer health via Catalyst, our CS platform.

  • Serve as the point of contact for your customers and drive them to specific business outcomes on their timelines.

  • Become a product expert on Vanta and how our platform can be used to improve security posture through our compliance offerings (SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR, HIPAA, USDP and Custom Frameworks), Trust Reports, and Risk Management solution.

  • Provide insightful technical answers and recommend the most efficient way for customers to achieve compliance using our platform while leveraging cross-functional resources and specialized teams.

  • Partner with your CS team to co-create plays to drive engagement across the Vanta customer base with impactful adoption and retention results.

  • Liaise with Support to help quarterback resolutions for customer issues

  • Serve as the voice of your customers cross-functionally, providing feedback to the Product team and broader business

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have 3+ years of experience in Customer Success at a SaaS company.

  • Background in running a book of business of 150-170 accounts.

  • Background in running a strategic book of business

  • Willingness to collaborate with others and drive mutually beneficial outcomes

  • Self-motivated and curious: Bias for action and committed to iterating when necessary

  • Work effectively in a highly ambiguous, ever-changing environment

  • Possess clear and thoughtful communication skills, with strong critical thinking ability

  • Be highly empathetic to customers, with a proven track record of long-term customer retention.

  • Experience with hitting retention targets and creating happy, healthy customers

  • Have stellar problem-solving chops, and an enthusiasm for making a large impact early on at a start-up

  • Experience working in the security or compliance industry is a bonus!

  • Fluency in German

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive salary and equity

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks paid parental leave for all new parents (birthing, non-birthing, and adoptive)

  • Health & wellness stipend

  • Remote workspace stipend

  • Commuter benefits for team members who attend the office

  • Pension matching

  • 25 days of PTO per year and unlimited sick time

  • 8 company paid holidays

jobs.title: Strategic Finance Manager, Marketing
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

The Strategic Finance team drives leverage and investing in opportunities for growth. Our team is tasked with building targets, setting budgets, and helping leaders execute against plans. This encompasses a wide breadth of business partnership and reporting for the Executive Team and Board of Directors. This dynamic team is responsible for in-depth data analysis and strategic awareness that drive decisions and the overall direction of the company.

As a Strategic Finance Manager, Marketing at Vanta, you will be a financial liaison between the Strategic Finance team and marketing functions at the company. You will be instrumental in providing strategic guidance, completing various projects related to investments Vanta makes across marketing activities, and budgeting/forecasting for the organization. This role will report into the Senior Manager of Strategic Finance, GTM and provides the opportunity to blend financial know-how, thought leadership, and business partnership. By doing so, you’ll not only strengthen our day-to-day execution but also unlock new strategic capacity for the Finance team and Vanta as a whole. This role is ideal for someone who combines financial expertise with a builder’s mindset and thrives in creating scalable systems that enable growth. You will use sound business judgement and critical thinking to unlock growth within the business. Top performers challenge accepted norms and back up their beliefs with data driven decision making.

What you’ll do as a Strategic Finance Manager, Marketing:

  • Cross-functional collaboration: Partner with Demand & Growth, Corporate Marketing teams, Accounting, and other GTM business leaders to enable key stakeholders on insights produced and provide recommendations to improve business outcomes.

  • Deliver strategic insights: Lead financial efforts and provide insights on various projects such as return on investment for marketing spend, KPI reporting and optimization, and external benchmarking.

  • Be an athlete: Thrive in the end-to-end process of nimbly providing real-time insights that can translate into frameworks for long-term success.

  • Think critically: Identify topics that merit further investigation and utilize data and frameworks to provide new perspectives.

  • Operationalize planning: Oversee marketing headcount management and movement tracking to forecast and manage departmental costs. Operate as Finance liaison for the annual operating plan and long range planning processes.

  • Enforce spend discipline: Serve as the Finance approver on marketing spend deployment. Identify major swings in spend, track against budget, and adjust forecasts in real time.

  • Deliver results: Prepare recommendations on incremental investment opportunities by weighing financial and strategic trade-offs

  • Manifest leadership: Share responsibilities with existing finance leadership, expanding the team’s reach into strategic and analytical support across the business.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Experience: 5+ years of related experience, ideally in corporate finance, financial planning, and analysis (FP&A), investment banking, or investment management. FP&A or strategic finance experience supporting SaaS businesses and/or the tech industry is critical

  • Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, Google Docs/Sheets/Slides. Bonus for experience in SQL and NetSuite

jobs.descriptionHtml:

We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

Our Senior Software Engineers lead and mentor engineers, delivering high-value products for our customers and infrastructure that enables our business to scale. As a Senior Software Engineer at Vanta, you’ll be responsible for setting technical direction to provide a strong foundation for our infrastructure to scale with our business. You will also drive complex projects across our technical stack and mentor our talented engineering team. Your past experience will be leveraged to enable and accelerate Vanta’s growth.

The GRC Policies team sits at the heart of Vanta’s product, powering the creation, management, and tracking of compliance policies throughout their lifecycle. This team is at the forefront of innovation, incorporating AI to enhance policy workflows and elevate our customers’ overall compliance programs.

This is a unique opportunity to blend impactful software engineering with cutting-edge applied AI.

What you’ll do as a Senior Backend Software Engineer at Vanta:

  • Design APIs from first principles, ensuring they are intuitive and usable by both code and AI agents.

  • Make thoughtful trade-offs that balance business objectives, user experience, and long-term technical sustainability.

  • Mentor and guide fellow engineers, promoting best practices across the team.

  • Lead initiatives that strengthen operational excellence and raise the bar on engineering quality across the organization.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have at least 8 years of industry experience with backend development.

  • Proven ability to design clean, effective internal APIs and services.

  • Hands-on experience with TypeScript, GraphQL, and MongoDB.

  • Demonstrated leadership of significant technical projects from inception through delivery.

  • A pragmatic approach to problem solving, with the ability to assess when to build versus buy, identify true customer needs, and execute with iteration in mind.

  • A product-minded engineer who empathizes with users and is driven to solve their problems.

  • Experience in building both early-stage (0 to 1) and scaling (1 to 10) systems with strong execution skills.

  • Previous experience applying AI in products, or a strong interest in exploring this space.

We’re growing quickly, continually outpacing our targets and leading the market in compliance and security. If you’re excited by the opportunity to drive strategic, high-value deals and work in a fast-paced, high-growth environment—we’d love to hear from you.

  • Engage directly with senior stakeholders (CISO, CIO, CTO) to deliver tailored, consultative value propositions

  • Work closely with legal, product, engineering, solution engineers, and GRC specialists throughout the deal cycle

  • Leverage and contribute to building the upmarket playbook, refining our GTM approach as we scale

  • Provide accurate forecasts and deliver consistently against quota

  • 5+ years in a closing Account Executive role, with at least 4 years selling Upmarket B2B SaaS

  • Proven ability to consistently meet/exceed quota, including managing 5+ six-figure deals per quarter

  • Strong outbound prospecting skills and ability to independently build a robust pipeline

  • Experience managing complex, multi-stakeholder sales cycles

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager, Growth
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As Vanta’s Customer Success Manager, Growth, you will play a pivotal role in guiding customers through their security and compliance journeys with Vanta's specialized solutions at scale. By combining your customer-centric approach with expertise in Vanta's products and security best practices, you will contribute to the overall success and satisfaction of Vanta's customers in achieving robust security and compliance outcomes through the retention of customers and the health of the book of business.

 

Vanta’s success over the last year was exponential and we are now working to solve the problem of how to provide world-class customer experience to as many security-minded software companies as possible. As Vanta’s Growth Customer Success Manager, you will be the voice of Vanta, responsible for helping keep our customers moving toward their goals and ultimately being successful and happy. 

What you’ll do as a Customer Success Manager, Growth at Vanta:

  • Work with Vanta customers across industries, functions, and stages of their customer journey in a 1:1 manner while also leveraging 1:many content.

  • Empower customers to become self-sufficient Vanta champions, solving their immediate needs while focusing on their long-term success, value realization, and retention

  • Monitor and prioritize your book of business based on key indicators of customer health via Catalyst, our CS platform.

  • Serve as the point of contact for your customers and drive them to specific business outcomes on their timelines.

  • Become a product expert on Vanta and how our platform can be used to improve security posture through our compliance offerings (SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR, HIPAA, USDP and Custom Frameworks), Trust Reports, and Risk Management solution.

  • Provide insightful technical answers and recommend the most efficient way for customers to achieve compliance using our platform while leveraging cross-functional resources and specialized teams.

  • Partner with your Growth CS team to co-create plays to drive engagement across the Vanta customer base with impactful adoption and retention results.

  • Proactively partner with Account managers by flagging at-risk accounts, providing customer insights, and highlighting expansion opportunities

  • Liaise with Support and Finance to help quarterback resolutions for customer issues

  • Serve as the voice of your customers cross-functionally, providing feedback to the Product team and broader business

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have 2+ years of experience in Customer Success at a SaaS company.

  • Background in running a large book of business at scale

  • Willingness to collaborate with others and drive mutually beneficial outcomes

  • Self-motivated and curious: Bias for action and committed to iterating when necessary

  • Work effectively in a highly ambiguous, ever-changing environment

  • Experience working in the security or compliance industry is preferred

  • Possess clear and thoughtful communication skills, with strong critical thinking ability

  • Be highly empathetic to customers, with a proven track record of long-term customer retention.

  • Experience with hitting retention targets and creating happy, healthy customers

  • Have stellar problem-solving chops, and an enthusiasm for making a large impact early on at a start-up

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, Dublin, and Sydney

The Director of Procurement will lead Vanta’s global procurement function, shaping strategy, managing high-profile negotiations, and driving operational excellence as a key business partner across the company. This role is highly visible, reporting directly to the CFO, and will have a direct impact on cost savings, scalability, and long-term growth.

What you’ll do as a Director of Procurement at Vanta:

  • Lead and scale Vanta’s global procurement function, overseeing multimillion-dollar vendor negotiations and managing strategic sourcing, vendor management, and contract strategy.

  • Own global procurement programs valued at tens of millions of dollars, ensuring consistency, compliance, and alignment across regions.

  • Build scalable processes and implement best practices to elevate procurement into a trusted, strategic business partner.

  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including GTM, ENG, IT, and Legal—to streamline workflows and support company-wide initiatives.

  • Establish and monitor procurement KPIs and SLAs, driving transparency and accountability across the organization.

  • Provide leadership and mentorship to a growing team of Senior Procurement Analysts, fostering a high-performance and growth-oriented culture.

  • Partner directly with company leadership to support scaling efforts, guide critical vendor decisions, and shape long-term procurement strategy.

How to be successful in this role:

  • 10+ years of procurement experience with at least 3-5 years in a leadership or management role.

  • Proven track record managing global procurement programs of $10M+ with responsibility for vendor negotiations, contracts, and sourcing strategy.

  • Exceptional communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to influence at the executive level and manage high-stakes vendor relationships.

  • Strong financial and analytical skills, with the ability to evaluate cost structures, margins, and long-term financial impacts.

  • Deep knowledge of emerging trends, procurement best practices, and leading procurement technologies.

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, scaling environment and build scalable processes from the ground up.

jobs.title: Senior Creative Producer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

We’re a dynamic company looking to break the mold—pushing our advertising beyond the conventional boundaries of typical SaaS and B2B campaigns.

Vanta is looking for a Senior Creative Producer to join the Brand Creative team and lead the production and execution of smart, brand-building campaigns that span across video, photo, digital, and integrated channels. In addition to campaign production, this role is responsible for overseeing the entirety of project management for the Brand Creative team, ensuring all day-to-day creative work is prioritized, resourced, and delivered smoothly.

The role is perfect for a proactive problem solver with deep experience in creative operations, advertising production, and cross-functional project management. They are expected to independently drive complex initiatives from start to finish, manage production partners, and ensure flawless execution across multiple formats. They will work closely with copywriters, designers, marketers, media buyers, and external vendors to keep projects on strategy, on time, and on budget.

The right candidate brings substantial production experience, ranging from photo and video shoots to digital campaigns, and thrives in fast-moving, high-growth environments. They are confident in building scalable processes, partnering with creative leadership, and pushing the quality bar higher with every deliverable.

What you’ll do as a Senior Creative Producer at Vanta:

  • Oversee the full creative project pipeline, including day-to-day requests, marketing deliverables, and larger campaign initiatives, ensuring the team is resourced, prioritized, and operating smoothly.

  • Own the full lifecycle of creative initiatives: from intake and scoping, through kickoff, production, reviews, and final delivery.

  • Scope, budget, and manage production for advertising campaigns, including photo shoots, video shoots, animation, and live-action productions.

  • Help source, negotiate, and manage external partners (agencies, directors, photographers, editors, animators, etc.), ensuring the right fit for each project.

  • Streamline workflows, approvals, and documentation so the team can work efficiently and scale output.

  • Facilitate cross-functional alignment by running kickoffs, standups, reviews, and post-mortems.

  • Serve as the operational backbone of the Brand Creative team, keeping stakeholders informed, ensuring deliverables meet expectations, and mitigating risks before they escalate.

  • Help introduce new processes, tools, and templates (including leveraging AI) to improve efficiency and creative output.

  • Build trust across marketing and growth teams as the go-to for flawless campaign execution.

How to be successful in this role:

  • 10+ years of creative production and/or project management experience, including a minimum of 8 years supporting advertising campaigns.

  • Understanding of advertising production: live-action, photo, animation, and digital.

  • Proven ability to manage complex projects, multiple stakeholders, and competing deadlines.

  • Experience sourcing, negotiating, and managing creative vendors and production partners.

  • Strong organizational skills and impeccable attention to detail.

  • Excellent presentation and communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate timelines, risks, and decisions.

  • A proactive, solutions-oriented mindset (you anticipate issues before they arise.)

  • Experience in high-growth tech/startup environments is a plus.

Nice to have:

  • Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Jira) and design tools (e.g., Figma).

  • Experience with contracts, licensing, and talent management.

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney

This role will act as a strategic business partner to our Mid-Market and Enterprise sales teams, designing and executing programs that enable our sellers to navigate complex sales cycles and win with large organizations. In this role, you will build and deliver impactful enablement programs that elevate seller performance and accelerate revenue growth, ensuring Vanta’s value is consistently and effectively communicated to upmarket prospects and customers.

This role will collaborate cross-functionally with product marketing, campaigns, sales operations, and other teams to ensure the sales team is prepared and effective in selling Upmarket.This is an amazing opportunity for a driven sales enablement professional to lead and execute impactful programs across our growing Upmarket team.

What you’ll do as an Upmarket GTM Enablement Manager:

  • Collaborate with our GTM Onboarding Manager to develop onboarding content and certifications to significantly reduce time-to-productivity for new hires, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of Vanta’s Upmarket sales process, messaging, and product value.

  • Proactively identify skill and productivity gaps with input from leadership as well as insights from GTM Ops to design training roadmaps to bridge these gaps.

  • Standardize and reinforce key sales cycles stages, including discovery, pitching, executive alignment, competitive positioning and closing strategies to ensure consistent and repeatable sales execution.

  • Delivery regularly group and team training sessions, 1:1 coaching, deal reviews, and additional programs that drive performance outcomes

  • Partner with PMM to develop and enable effective talk tracks, competitive battlecards, objection handling frameworks, and value propositions tailored to segment specific personas and industry verticals

  • Evaluate our eLearning and content playbooks and partner with the GTM Content Enablement Manager to iterate and improve.

  • Measure and analyze the effectiveness of enablement initiatives using data from platforms like Gong and Salesforce to identify trends, drive continuous improvement, and make data-informed adjustments.

How to be successful in this role:

  • 5+ years of experience in an GTM Enablement, Sales Enablement or equivalent role. Bonus if you have experience in a quota carrying position. Strong preference for candidates with experience in enterprise sales, ideally with a focus on large, complex accounts

  • Experience with COM or additional sales methodologies and MEDDPICC qualification criteria.

  • Ability to design and deliver impactful training, both in-person and virtual, and provide targeted coaching

  • Strong project management skills to manage complex, cross-functional enablement initiatives.

  • Expertise in GTM enablement tech including Learning Management Systems (Workramp, Docebo, Brainshark, etc), Content Management Systems (Seismic, Highspot) and Knowledge Management Systems (Guru), Conversational Analysis tools (Gong, Chorus, etc).

  • Ability to collaborate effectively with various stakeholders and influence senior leaders to drive clarity and results.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to engage and educate diverse audiences.

  • A data-driven mindset to track enablement effectiveness and business outcomes, using tools and platforms to gather insights.

  • Passion for learning and development, with a commitment to driving continuous improvements

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

We're scaling our Startups Sales team with customer-focused Account Executives who will take ownership of their entire sales cycle and distinguish Vanta as best-in-class to prospects in a burgeoning competitive landscape.

Vanta is growing quickly, we're profitable, and we're continually outpacing our growth targets while maintaining very strong NPS scores. Our Sales team is leading the charge in exceeding our revenue goals and growing our market share as the industry leader in compliance and security.

 

If this sounds like you, and you're excited to join a growing sales team, we'd love to hear from you.
