  • Identify high-potential business verticals to develop and execute outbound strategies to engage them with Vanta.

  • Manage the entire sales cycle, from initial contact to contract negotiation and closing, with a focus on expediting deals within a 30-day timeframe.

  • Turn our inbound demand into closed-new business and happy Vanta customers.

  • Manage our sales pipeline, improving and maturing our sales process and playbook.

  • Define and communicate the specific benefits of Vanta appropriate for each customer, including making sales materials and demos.

  • Collect insights from prospects for our product development process.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have had a closing and quota-carrying role 2+ years, while consistently exceeding monthly and quarterly sales targets

  • Be experienced in B2B SaaS, preferably in SMB with a focus on short deal cycles.

  • Be highly empathetic to customers, with a proven track record of long-term customer retention.

  • Possess the technical competency to understand Vanta’s software and build great relationships with highly technical prospects.

  • Have stellar problem-solving chops, and an enthusiasm for making a large impact early on at a start-up.

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive salary and equity

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative, Specialty Sales
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) at Vanta, you will play a foundational role in building outbound pipeline for our fast-growing new products: Vendor Risk Management (VRM), Customer Trust Management (CTM), and Vanta for Government (V4G). This role is perfect for a scrappy, driven SDR who thrives in a 0-to-1 motion, where playbooks are still being developed, and creativity is key to breaking into new markets.

About the Team

Vanta’s Go-To-Market team is expanding its focus beyond our core product to drive growth in new product lines and government compliance solutions. Our team’s mission is to build scalable outbound motions that create new revenue streams and help businesses simplify security and compliance across industries.

How This Role Contributes

As an SDR on this team, you will be responsible for identifying and engaging high-potential accounts, running strategic outbound prospecting efforts, and partnering with AEs to generate pipeline. You’ll be at the forefront of our expansion efforts, helping shape how we sell these products and refining outbound strategies to drive measurable impact.

This role is hybrid in our NY or SF offices 3 days per week (Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays). Please only apply if you are willing to commute into the office or relocate.

What you’ll do as a Specialty Sales SDR at Vanta:

  • Develop and execute outbound strategies to generate pipeline for Vendor Risk Management (VRM), Customer Trust Management (CTM), or Vanta for Government.

  • Identify, research, and engage target accounts through multi-channel outreach (email, LinkedIn, phone).

  • Test and iterate on messaging to optimize response rates and drive qualified meetings.

  • Partner closely with AEs and Marketing to refine targeting, share prospect insights, and enhance outbound sequences.

  • Leverage CRM and sales tools (Salesforce, Outreach, LinkedIn Sales Navigator) to track outreach effectiveness and improve engagement.

  • Provide feedback on market trends and objections, helping shape Vanta’s go-to-market strategy for these new product lines.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. As a member of Vanta’s Account Management team, you will be responsible for the expansion and retention of a subset of Vanta’s Customers by developing and maintaining strong relationships with our customers. You will serve as the primary point of contact for all post-sale commercial conversations, including mid-cycle upsells and renewals. As a trusted advisor to the customer, you will deeply understand their business needs and align Vanta’s solutions with their objectives to help mature our customers’ compliance and security program. 

The goal of this team is to achieve overall net revenue expansion of the Vanta customer base, as measured by Net Revenue Retention. They will ensure customer’s security and compliance goals are aligned to their company growth needs and with Vanta’s solutions. 

What you’ll do as an Account Manager at Vanta:

  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with assigned accounts, acting as a trusted advisor and strategic partner.

  • Develop a deep understanding of Vanta’s current product offerings and take initiative to learn Vanta’s product roadmap to speak confidently when addressing customers. 

  • Maintain strong partnerships and alignment with CSMs to understand customer health, ensure close strategic collaboration and execute harmonious communication to accounts. 

  • Collaborate on account plans that identify new opportunities for expansion with current customers to increase their usage of Vanta’s platform via new frameworks, security tools, etc. 

  • Manage the entire sales cycle of any expansion or renewal opportunity from first meeting to close, negotiating where necessary and pulling in additional internal resources where appropriate (solutions consultants, subject matter experts, etc). 

  • Accurately forecast monthly expansion and churn, and maintain a clean SFDC instance with scrutinous pipeline hygiene. 

  • Keep a relentless focus on the customer needs and provide a consultative approach in architecting a solution.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have 3+ years experience selling to or managing customers

  • Strong ability to prospect and build pipeline without assistance from BDR and/or inbound support

  • Exceptional communication skills (written, verbal, visual), both for internal audiences and customer-facing messaging

  • Be highly motivated with a sense of urgency and willingness to adjust

  • Able to effectively collaborate with a wide range of departments including CS, Marketing, Enablement, and Support

  • Previous experience in security and compliance is not required, but highly desirable!

jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

Vanta is growing quickly and we're continually moving upmarket, dealing with sophisticated customers with complex security and compliance environments and needs. Our Security team uses our own Security and Privacy GRC experience to meet customer demand to help grow our market share as the industry leader in compliance and security.

As a Subject Matter Expert, GRC at Vanta, you will be a highly visible, customer-facing leader within Vanta’s Security team, responsible for representing Vanta’s Trust Management Platform to prospects and customers, as well as having a role in collaborating with and internal teams to help drive and implement new features in the product.

If this sounds like you, and you're excited to use your Security and GRC experience to help grow and sell our product, we'd love to hear from you.

What you’ll do as a GRC Subject Matter Expert (SME) at Vanta:

  • Partner with the Vanta's Sales and Customer Success teams to represent Vanta’s Trust Management Platform to prospects and customers 

  • Engage with executives and sr. staff at prospect and customer organizations to establish relationships with customer's Security and Compliance points of contact

  • Become an expert on the security features available for customers to deploy within Vanta, including best practices for implementation

  • Use your expert knowledge of compliance frameworks like SOC 2 and ISO 27001 to advise customers regarding questions about scoping, policy creation, detailed control requirements and security best practices

  • Collaborate with Vanta’s GTM team to improve processes and enable faster and more seamless experiences for our customers

  • Develop publicly-available marketing and education content for customers

  • Coordinate with cross-functional teams to provide customers with meaningful updates on features and programs

  • Identify requirements that would enable additional customer use cases and drive implementation of customer requirements with relevant stakeholders

  • Provide input and feedback on the development of security and GRC product features for Vanta’s customers

  • Answer questions for internal and external stakeholders about security and compliance

How to be successful in this role:

  • Experience working with security and privacy frameworks and regulations, including SOC2, ISO 27001, ISO 27701, GDPR, DORA, NIS2, TISAX, etc.

  • Demonstrable expertise in SOC 2 or ISO 27001 at minimum

  • Experience communicating with C-level customer contacts

  • Technical expertise to understand and explain security and GRC concepts

  • Familiarity with cloud infrastructure, version control systems, risk management, vulnerability management, and their related security processes 

  • Experience in building productive relationships and driving collaboration with both technical and non-technical teams

  • Knowledge of the cybersecurity audit process

  • Security compliance management experience within a SaaS environment preferred, but not required

  • Sales Engineering or Technical Support experience preferred, but not required

  • Security certifications (e.g. CISA, CISSP, CIPP/E) and/or formal education preferred, but not required

What you can expect as a Vant'an:

  • Industry-competitive salary and equity

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks paid parental leave for all new parents (birthing, non-birthing, and adoptive)

  • Health & wellness stipend

  • Remote workspace stipend

  • Commuter benefits for team members who attend the office

  • Pension matching

  • 25 days of PTO per year and unlimited sick time

  • 8 company paid holidays

  • Virtual team building activities, lunch and learns, and other company-wide events!

At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Senior Security Ops Analyst at Vanta, you will be responsible for helping us protect consumer data and Vanta—and continue to earn the trust of our customers. You’ll help configure, maintain, and monitor security tools and infrastructure, and partner with Security Engineers to implement preventative measures. You’ll be responsible for the triage, analysis, and investigation of security alerts, and escalate and support potential security incidents from detection to resolution. If you’re someone who has high initiative and enjoys problem solving while having impact at a high-growth company, we would love to hear from you!

  • Configure, maintain, and monitor security alerts and escalations from different tools and platforms

  • Monitor and distill global threat intelligence trends with potential impact on the business

  • Lead and drive incident response from detection, remediation, to prevention

  • Conduct incident root cause analysis and recommend actions to prevent future incidents

  • Configure new alerts based on trends or the results of threat hunts or alert triage

  • Identify, develop, and implement new processes in our security operations program

  • Respond to internal security-related questions and requests from Vanta’ns

  • Support any function, team, or initiative that requires security expertise

  • Experience writing and responding to detections in cloud-native and remote-first environments

  • Commuter benefits for team members who attend the office

jobs.title: Senior Fullstack Engineer, Trust
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As one of the fastest-growing organizations at Vanta and the first to leverage AI, the Trust team is responsible for driving innovation through artificial intelligence, disrupting the security industry with continuous, automated monitoring and delivering more accurate insights to help customers make informed decisions. You'll be working on 0→1 initiatives, shaping the future of security with cutting-edge AI capabilities. The Trust organization owns three distinct AI-powered products (Trust Center, Questionnaire Automation, Vendor Risk Management ) and is actively innovating on new products. 

As a Senior Full-Stack Software Engineer, you’ll lead high-impact, ambiguous projects across our entire technical stack, playing a key role in shaping the direction of our product. You’ll collaborate closely with customers to deeply understand their needs and mentor a talented engineering team to deliver innovative, scalable solutions.

Our business has found incredible product-market fit and has monetized effectively since the day we signed our first customer. We’re growing at a blistering pace, which presents career-defining opportunities for engineers to accelerate their growth and to contribute to a rapidly-scaling company.

Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. We’d love for you to join us!

Visit our Vanta Engineering Blog to learn more about what our team is working on! 

About the Role at Vanta:

As a Senior Software Engineer at Vanta, you’ll be responsible for leading complex, cross-functional projects that may span across teams and systems. Senior Engineers at Vanta have a demonstrated history of leadership—you will define architecture, scope and assign work, align stakeholders, mentor engineers, and ship critical components, and you have a lengthy track record of doing this. You’ll help develop and scale Vanta’s Trust Products, and guide technical growth across the org.

Vanta’s levels are a little different than other tech companies- we often see people with Staff or Principal titles at other organizations with scope that matches our Senior level.

What You’ll Do as a Senior Software Engineer at Vanta

  • Lead initiatives: bring clarity to ambiguity, define product scope, and solve for technical complexity.

  • Work with Product and Design partners to shape technical solutions that meet real customer needs.

  • Define architecture, delegate implementation across multiple engineers, and ensure successful outcomes.

  • Deliver key portions of the project directly while reviewing and unblocking others.

  • Drive knowledge sharing and mentor engineers, including senior engineers

  • Setting long term technical strategy for your team and raise engineering quality bar

How to be successful in this role:

  • Minimum of 7 years of product-side Fullstack experience; there is no maximum, we often hire Senior Engineers who have 7–10+ years baseline of product delivery and tech lead experience

  • Have experience with our stack: Typescript, React, GraphQL

  • Has a track record of successfully led highly ambiguous and complex project where problems and solutions are not well defined, while coordinating groups of engineers and working with cross functional stakeholders

  • Demonstrated ability to operate with autonomy, align product and engineering needs, and land high-quality outcomes.

  • Trusted to lead not just code, but also planning, process, and culture.

  • Mentors across levels at a team-wide scale; a technical role model and coach. Contributes to/leads programs which uplevel the code quality of the team.

If this sounds interesting to you, but you have even more extensive experience as a leader, please consider applying for our Staff Fullstack Engineer role

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney

To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors and may vary based on candidate location, skills, depth of work experience, and relevant licenses/credentials.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As Vanta’s Customer Success Manager within the Customer Success Advisory, you will be required to be based within the Eastern Time Zone, and play a pivotal role in guiding a diverse portfolio of customers through their security and compliance journeys with Vanta's specialized solutions. Working closely with your CSA team, you will engage with customers through a combination of proactive email outreach, calls, and collaborative use of a shared inbox. Your mission is to ensure the retention and satisfaction of Vanta’s customers by providing world-class customer service at scale, driving customer health, and maintaining a thriving book of business.

Vanta’s success over the last year was exponential and we are now working to solve the problem of how to provide world-class customer experience to as many security-minded software companies as possible. As Vanta’s Customer Success Manager within the Customer Success Advisory, you will be the voice of Vanta, responsible for helping keep our customers moving toward their goals and ultimately being successful and happy.

What you’ll do as Customer Success Manager as Vanta:

  • Serve as a key advisor to a broad range of customers across different industries, roles, and stages of their journey, using a blend of 1:1 and 1:many
    approaches to maximize impact and engagement.

  • Leverage email campaigns, calls, and a shared inbox to anticipate and address customer needs, ensuring they remain on track to achieve their security and compliance goals.

  • Enable customers to become self-sufficient Vanta advocates by guiding them through immediate challenges while setting them up for long-term success, value realization, and retention.

  • Utilize our CS platform, Catalyst, to track and prioritize customer health indicators across your book of business, making data-driven decisions to enhance customer outcomes.

  • Develop a deep understanding of Vanta's platform and its applications, advising customers on how to optimize their use of our compliance offerings (SOC 2, ISO 27001, GDPR, HIPAA, USDP, Custom Frameworks), Trust Reports, and Risk Management solutions.

  • Partner closely with your Scale CSA team to co-develop and execute plays that drive customer engagement, adoption, and retention across the entire Vanta customer base.

  • Proactively identify at-risk accounts, provide detailed customer insights, and collaborate with Account Managers to uncover expansion opportunities.

  • Coordinate with Support and Finance to efficiently resolve customer issues, ensuring a seamless and positive experience.

  • Act as a customer advocate, channeling feedback and insights to the Product team and broader organization to drive continuous improvement.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have 2+ years of experience in Customer Success at a SaaS company.

  • Background in running a large book of business at scale

  • Willingness to collaborate with others and drive mutually beneficial outcomes

  • Self-motivated and curious: Bias for action and committed to iterating when necessary

  • Work effectively in a highly ambiguous, ever-changing environment

  • Experience working in the security or compliance industry is preferred

  • Possess clear and thoughtful communication skills, with strong critical thinking ability

  • Be highly empathetic to customers, with a proven track record of long-term customer retention.

  • Experience with hitting retention targets and creating happy, healthy customers

  • Have stellar problem-solving chops, and an enthusiasm for making a large impact early on at a start-up

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney

jobs.title: Head of Commercial Legal
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As Vanta’s Head of Commercial Legal, you’ll run the commercial legal function, working closely with go to market and procurement to manage Vanta’s contract negotiations and processes as we continue to grow our customer base.

The Head of of Commercial Legal will be responsible for the entire commercial legal function, including overseeing and negotiating key deals and relationships, developing new processes and improving existing ones, acting as a trusted business partner, and managing the commercial team. Reporting to the Head of Legal, your responsibilities will include ownership of all aspects of Vanta’s negotiations with customers and vendors and associated processes, instituting policies and processes while maintaining hypergrowth, and oversight of legal operations. The ideal candidate will have experience in managing a team of attorneys strategically working with global sales teams to execute and negotiate commercial transactions and contracts supporting a company through hypergrowth.

What you’ll do as Head of Commercial Legal at Vanta:

  • Manage our incredibly efficient, productive team of commercial lawyers.

  • Negotiate customer and partner deals in collaboration with the global sales organization.

  • Negotiate vendor contracts and ensure that Vanta and its customers are protected.

  • Manage escalations, collaborate across other teams, and develop solutions to enable team and business partners to close deals.

  • Provide counsel to the business regarding the business environment, challenges, and objectives.

  • Oversee the management and maintenance of all company legal templates, including our MSA, Privacy Policy, DPA, etc.

  • Ensure our contracts are delivering the right objectives for the company & mitigate risk.

  • Stay up to date on changes in laws and regulations impacting the business and communicate to appropriate parties any changes to controls, policies and procedures.

  • Evaluate risk factors impacting business decisions and anticipate unique legal issues that could affect the company.

jobs.title: Account Executive, Startups - EMEA
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

Vanta is growing fast—we’re profitable, consistently exceeding our growth targets, and maintaining exceptionally strong NPS scores along the way. Our momentum is driven by a clear mission: to secure the internet and help startups scale with trust. As the category leader in compliance and security automation, we’re capturing market share rapidly, and our Sales team is at the forefront of that charge.

To support this continued growth, we’re expanding our Startups Sales team. We’re looking for high-energy, customer-focused Account Executives who thrive in high-volume, fast-paced environments and are motivated by the challenge of turning velocity into results. In this role, you’ll take full ownership of the sales cycle—from first touch to close—and play a critical role in positioning Vanta as the go-to solution for early-stage companies navigating security and compliance for the first time.

This is a highly transactional, new business role where success comes from running a tight, repeatable process and maintaining a high daily output.

If you love the energy of working with startups, are driven to outperform targets, and want to make a tangible impact in a rapidly scaling business, we’d love to hear from you.

This role will be based in our London office with an office-centric hybrid schedule. The standard in-office days are Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday.

What you’ll do as an Account Executive, Startups - EMEA at Vanta:

  • Identify high-potential business verticals to develop and execute outbound strategies to engage them with Vanta.

  • Manage the entire sales cycle, from initial contact to contract negotiation and closing, with a focus on speed and efficiency, aiming to close deals within a 30-day timeframe.

  • Turn our inbound demand into closed-won business quickly and consistently, working across a large number of prospects

  • Operate in a fast-paced, transactional sales environment, running a high number of discovery calls and managing a broad pipeline of opportunities simultaneously.

  • Continuously optimize your sales workflow to maintain high activity levels, improve conversion, and deliver repeatable results.

  • Define and communicate the value of Vanta to prospects, including tailoring sales materials and demos to resonate with early-stage startup buyers

  • Surface product feedback and trends from prospects to inform go-to-market and product development strategies.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have 12+ months in a closing and quota-carrying role, while consistently exceeding monthly and quarterly sales targets

  • Experience in B2B SaaS, ideally focused on SMB or early-stage startups, where short deal cycles and high activity are the norm

  • Thrive in high-velocity sales environments and are energized by repetition, fast decision-making, and a transactional approach to deal flow

  • Be highly empathetic to customers, with a proven track record of long-term customer retention.

  • Possess the technical competency to understand Vanta’s software and build great relationships with highly technical prospects.

  • Have stellar problem-solving chops, and an enthusiasm for making a large impact early on at a start-up.

  • You’re intrinsically motivated, proactive, and resourceful—comfortable taking initiative without needing direction

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive salary and equity

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks paid parental leave for all new parents (birthing, non-birthing, and adoptive)

  • Health & wellness stipend

  • Remote workspace stipend

  • Commuter benefits for team members who attend the office

  • Pension matching

  • 25 days of PTO per year and unlimited sick time

  • 8 company paid holidays

  • Virtual team building activities, lunch and learns, and other company-wide events!

jobs.title: Senior Manager, Benefits
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As Vanta’s Senior Manager, Benefits, you will lead and scale our global benefits function through a period of high growth and strategic transformation. You’ll be responsible for overseeing benefits strategy, vendor partnerships, and day-to-day operations across multiple countries, with a focus on maintaining competitive, cost-effective offerings that support our people and business needs.

You’ll provide subject matter expertise and operational leadership as we evaluate and evolve our benefits funding strategy, expand into new geographies, and align our offerings to meet the needs of a more diverse, distributed workforce. You will also manage a small but mighty global benefits team, providing guidance, mentorship, and operational support.

This role reports to Vanta’s Director of People Operations.

What you’ll do as a Senior Manager, Benefits at Vanta:

  • Own and evolve Vanta’s global benefits strategy, balancing competitiveness, employee experience, and cost management

  • Evaluate and design localized benefits plans that align with cultural norms and statutory requirements across new countries and regions (e.g., EMEA, LATAM, APAC)

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for our benefits brokers and vendors, evaluating and negotiating relationships to ensure best-in-class service and value

  • Lead the evaluation and implementation of key funding model transitions (e.g., level-funded plans, eventual move to self-insurance), in partnership with Finance and Legal

  • Oversee the design and rollout of benefits in new markets as Vanta expands globally, including plan structure, vendor sourcing, and compliance

  • Collaborate with People Business Partners and Total Rewards to ensure benefits offerings are aligned with employee needs, compensation programs, and business priorities

  • Design and deliver clear benefits communications that educate and empower employees during open enrollment, onboarding, and life events

  • Use benchmarking data and internal analytics to make recommendations on plan design, eligibility, and cost-sharing strategies

  • Maintain compliance with all federal, state, and international regulations related to benefits, including ACA, ERISA, COBRA, and local statutory requirements

How to be successful in this role:

  • 7+ years of experience in benefits management, with 2+ years of people leadership experience

  • Experience owning global benefits programs in a high-growth technology or startup environment. Know what “good looks like” in terms of evolving benefits design during a period of hyper growth.

  • Proven ability to design and execute benefits strategy, particularly in evolving funding models (level-funded, self-insured, etc.)

  • Deep understanding of U.S. benefits regulations and familiarity with benefits structures and compliance across key international markets

  • Strong project management skills with experience rolling out benefits changes across diverse and distributed teams

  • Analytical mindset with ability to assess plan performance, vendor data, and cost impacts to drive smart decisions

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially when translating complex benefits concepts into employee-friendly language

  • Comfortable working cross-functionally with Finance, Legal, and executive leadership on cost modeling, budgeting, and risk management

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive compensation

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness and remote workplace stipends

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney

To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar-stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors and may vary based on candidate location, skills, depth of work experience, and relevant licenses/credentials.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a member of Vanta’s Account Management team, you will be responsible for the expansion and retention of a subset of Vanta’s Customers by developing and maintaining strong relationships with our customers. You will serve as the primary point of contact for all post-sale commercial conversations, including mid-cycle upsells and renewals. As a trusted advisor to the customer, you will deeply understand their business needs and align Vanta’s solutions with their objectives to help mature our customers’ compliance and security program. 

The goal of this team is to achieve overall net revenue expansion of the Vanta customer base, as measured by Net Revenue Retention. They will ensure customer’s security and compliance goals are aligned to their company growth needs and with Vanta’s solutions. 

What you’ll do as a Sr. Account Manager at Vanta:

  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with assigned accounts, acting as a trusted advisor and strategic partner.

  • Develop a deep understanding of Vanta’s current product offerings and take initiative to learn Vanta’s product roadmap to speak confidently when addressing customers. 

  • Maintain strong partnerships and alignment with CSMs to understand customer health, ensure close strategic collaboration and execute harmonious communication to accounts. 

  • Collaborate on account plans that identify new opportunities for expansion with current customers to increase their usage of Vanta’s platform via new frameworks, security tools, etc. 

  • Manage the entire sales cycle of any expansion or renewal opportunity from first meeting to close, negotiating where necessary and pulling in additional internal resources where appropriate (solutions consultants, subject matter experts, etc). 

  • Accurately forecast monthly expansion and churn, and maintain a clean SFDC instance with scrutinous pipeline hygiene. 

  • Keep a relentless focus on the customer needs and provide a consultative approach in architecting a solution.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have 5+ years experience selling to or managing customers

  • Strong ability to prospect and build pipeline without assistance from BDR and/or inbound support

  • Exceptional communication skills (written, verbal, visual), both for internal audiences and customer-facing messaging

  • Be highly motivated with a sense of urgency and willingness to adjust

  • Able to effectively collaborate with a wide range of departments including CS, Marketing, Enablement, and Support

  • Previous experience in security and compliance is not required, but highly desirable!

As a Founding Account Executive focused on the Middle East at Vanta, you’ll drive our growth across the Middle East and EMEA, owning the full sales cycle from prospecting to close. You’ll act as a trusted advisor to CISOs, CTOs, and compliance leaders, helping them navigate security and compliance automation at scale. This is a strategic, high-visibility role and is ideal for someone who thrives in an entrepreneurial environment and wants to shape how we sell into a rapidly expanding market.

What You’ll Do

  • Own the end-to-end sales cycle from pipeline generation to negotiation and close with executive-level stakeholders.

  • Develop and execute go-to-market strategies for high-potential industries in the Middle East.

  • Partner cross-functionally with Marketing, RevOps, and Product to tailor messaging, identify trends, and shape our EMEA strategy.

  • Convert inbound demand into long-term customers while building and expanding outbound motion in the region.

  • Act as a voice of the customer to product and leadership teams to inform roadmap decisions.

What Success Looks Like

  • You consistently exceed quota through a consultative, strategic sales approach.

  • You’re viewed internally as a subject matter expert and externally as a trusted advisor.

  • You’re instrumental in building the foundation for Vanta’s Middle East GTM playbook.

What We’re Looking For

  • 5+ years of full-cycle closing experience in B2B SaaS, ideally selling to MM and Upmarket Accounts

  • Track record of exceeding targets in high-velocity and consultative sales environments.

  • Proven ability to build pipeline from scratch, especially in new or emerging markets.

  • Experience engaging technical and compliance stakeholders (CISOs, CTOs, Heads of Security).

  • Strong business acumen and a passion for helping customers navigate the security/compliance landscape.

  • Fluency in written and spoken English and Arabic required

  • Bonus: familiarity with the Middle Eastern tech ecosystem and/or experience selling into regulated industries.

jobs.title: Director, Go-to-Market Systems
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As the Director of Go-to-market Systems at Vanta, you will be responsible for ensuring our tools and systems help our go-to-market teams effectively serve our reps, customers and prospects with a best-in-class experience.

You and your team will be responsible for building and maintaining a best-in-class tooling suite that accelerates our team’s performance through a world-class user experience. This includes effectively integrating tools together, leveraging AI, and building processes to ensure our teams have the data and support to provide an incredible experience for our customers. You will lead a team of engineers, admins, and analysts, driving excellence in execution, stability, and user experience.

What you’ll do as a Director, Go-to-Market Systems at Vanta:

  • Own the complete end-to-end delivery and improvement of Go-to-Market systems

  • Design the technical architecture of go-to-market systems, ensuring scalability and stability

  • Enable your teams to deploy scalable workflows, integrations, and automations

  • Effectively manage the development lifecycle, ensuring effective prioritization that is aligned with the Go-to-Market strategy and eliminating technical debt.

  • Set the vision for a world-class user experience for Go-to-Market teams through optimization of current tools, workflows, and integrations.

  • Hire, manage, and develop a strong and high-performing team of admins, engineers, and product analysts.

  • Ensure strong adoption of tools to maximize usage of tooling

  • Own and lead an AI adoption roadmap, ensuring our tools are leveraging AI

  • Monitor and own system health and stability, ensuring high uptime and limited bugs

  • Effectively manage change through strong stakeholder communication and roadmap planning

How to be successful in this role:

  • Owned and led Go-to-Market systems teams in a SaaS environment for the last 8+ years

  • Strong understanding of sales-led GTM motions in B2B SaaS environments

  • Experience designing and implementing scalable workflows, integrations, and automations focused on user experience

  • Excellent communication and leadership skills with a proven ability in stakeholder management

  • Problem solver who is willing to operate at multiple levels, including executive-level communication

  • 4+ years of experience scaling systems teams in high-growth B2B sales organizations

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager, Startups - APJ
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Vanta Customer Success Manager, you will play a pivotal role in guiding customers through their security and compliance journeys with Vanta's specialized solutions. By combining your customer-centric approach with expertise in Vanta's products and security best practices, you will contribute to the overall success and satisfaction of Vanta's customers in achieving robust security and compliance outcomes through retention of customers and health of the book of business.

Vanta’s success over the last year was exponential and we are now working to solve the problem of how to provide world-class customer experience to as many security-minded software companies as possible. As a Vanta Customer Success Manager, you will be the voice of Vanta, responsible for helping keep our customers moving toward their goals and ultimately successful and happy.

What you’ll do as a Customer Success Manager at Vanta:

  • Guide our customers in our Startups segment through onboarding, implementation, product adoption, and value-driven success.

  • Work with Vanta customers across industries, functions, and stages of their customer journey in a 1:1 manner while also leveraging 1:many content.

  • Proactively partner with Account managers by flagging at-risk accounts, providing customer insights, and highlighting expansion opportunities

  • Empower customers to become self-sufficient Vanta champions, solving their immediate needs while focusing on their long-term success, value realization, and retention.

  • Proactively partner with Account managers by flagging at-risk accounts, providing customer insights, and highlighting expansion opportunities

About the Team

Vanta’s Go-To-Market team is expanding its focus beyond our core product to drive growth in new product lines and government compliance solutions. Our team’s mission is to build scalable outbound motions that create new revenue streams and help businesses simplify security and compliance across industries.

How This Role Contributes

As an SDR on this team, you will be responsible for identifying and engaging high-potential accounts, running strategic outbound prospecting efforts, and partnering with AEs to generate pipeline. You’ll be at the forefront of our expansion efforts, helping shape how we sell these products and refining outbound strategies to drive measurable impact.

  • Test and iterate on messaging to optimize response rates and drive qualified meetings.

  • Partner closely with AEs and Marketing to refine targeting, share prospect insights, and enhance outbound sequences.

  • Leverage CRM and sales tools (Salesforce, Outreach, LinkedIn Sales Navigator) to track outreach effectiveness and improve engagement.

  • Provide feedback on market trends and objections, helping shape Vanta’s go-to-market strategy for these new product lines.

How to be successful in this role:

  • 10 - 24 months of experience in an outbound SDR, BDR, or sales role, preferably in SaaS, security, compliance, or government sales.

  • Proven ability to generate pipeline through outbound prospecting, with a track record of booking meetings and exceeding activity goals.

  • Strong research and personalization skills, with the ability to craft compelling outreach to different buyer personas.

  • Adaptability and problem-solving mindset, with comfort working in a 0-to-1 motion where processes are still being defined.

  • Experience using sales tools like Salesforce, Outreach, and LinkedIn Sales Navigator.

  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate complex solutions simply and persuasively.

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • 16 weeks fully-paid parental Leave for all new parents

  • Family planning benefits through Carrot Fertility

  • 401(k) matching

  • Flexible work hours and location

  • Open PTO policy

  • 11 paid holidays in the US

  • Offices in SF, NYC, London, Dublin, and Sydney

Vanta’s business, technology surface, and team are growing—this provides a career-defining opportunity for you to grow as an engineering leader. It’s essential that we accelerate Vanta’s engineering discipline through an innovative developer environment while investing in the right abstractions and systems to enable us to scale to more customers and product lines. You’ll leverage your past experience and play a crucial role in laying the groundwork for a successful engineering organization, contributing to developing foundational processes that enable our entire team, and organization, to scale. Our business has an incredible product-market fit and effectively monetized since the day we signed our first customer.

  • Excellent communication skills to build consensus with stakeholders and articulate the value of frontend infra and developer tools.

  • Experience planning, scoping, and executing on cross-org migrations with an emphasis on limiting migration cost to consumers.

jobs.title: Product GRC SME
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As Vanta rapidly grows and moves upmarket, we’re working with increasingly sophisticated customers who have complex security and compliance needs across a wide range of industries and geographies. The GRC Subject Matter Experts play a critical role in delivering high-quality, scalable content and product guidance to help these companies effectively manage their GRC programs.

As Vanta’s newest GRC Subject Matter Expert, you’ll be responsible for developing and maintaining multi-framework GRC solutions used by thousands of customers. Acting as a bridge between Product Management, Engineering, Design, Sales, and Customer Success, you’ll ensure our solutions align with key security, privacy, and risk frameworks and real-world customer needs. You’ll play a pivotal role in designing, validating, and improving compliance-related content and capabilities while providing strategic input to shape Vanta’s GRC product roadmap.

You’ll join Vanta’s Security organization, which provides essential security operational services, is directly involved in the software development process, sets policies and standards regarding enterprise-wide security requirements, and offers advisory services to enable our business to thrive while effectively managing risk. If you’re someone who has high initiative and enjoys solving complex problems with real customer impact, we’d love to hear from you!

What you’ll do as a GRC SME at Vanta:

  • Build and maintain compliance frameworks - Lead the creation, enhancement, and lifecycle management of controls, evidence requirements, and implementation guidance for standards such as SOC 2, ISO/IEC 27001 & 27701, HIPAA, PCI DSS, NIST CSF, NIST SP 800-53, and regional regulations (e.g., GDPR/CCPA). Author clear control rationales, acceptance criteria, and customer-facing guidance.

  • Design crosswalks and mappings (framework‑agnostic) - Create and steward an internal common‑control approach informed by industry catalogs (e.g., SCF, UCF, or similar). Maintain bidirectional crosswalks across industry leading security and privacy regulatory frameworks. Define canonical control IDs, mapping confidence, and evidence data dictionaries; version crosswalks with changelogs and traceability to source authority. Partner with Engineering to operationalize mappings in‑product (integrations, automated tests, exceptions/exemptions, continuous monitoring workflows).

  • Elevate content quality and usability - Define standards for control wording, evidence specificity, testing method, and reviewer guidance. Establish content QA processes, audits, and metrics (e.g., adoption, time-to-evidence, completion rates) to continually improve outcomes.

jobs.title: Startups Sales Manager - APJ
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Startups Sales Manager at Vanta, you’ll have the opportunity to build, lead, and develop a team of ambitious Account Executives focused on helping early-stage companies grow securely. You'll collaborate closely with senior leadership and cross-functional partners including product, marketing, and engineering to expand our presence in the startup and small business segment. Your work will directly shape Vanta’s go-to-market strategy as we scale, refine our sales motion, and strengthen our position as the leading trust management platform for startups.

You'll partner with your team to drive new business growth, working with founders and early operators at fast-growing companies to transform how they approach security and compliance. This is your chance to make a substantial impact at an innovative, mission-driven company.

You’ll be stepping into a proven, high-performing part of the business with strong momentum — and the opportunity to take it even further. Our team is talented, supportive, and diverse, with many successful contributors coming from backgrounds outside of security.

What you’ll do as a Startups Sales Manager at Vanta:

  • Lead, mentor, and coach a small but high-performing team of Account Executives, equipping them with the tools and guidance to succeed in fast-paced, founder-led sales cycles.

  • Drive new business growth through proactive outbound prospecting, consultative value selling, and ownership of the full sales cycle.

  • Build and refine repeatable sales playbooks and processes that can scale as the team grows.

  • Provide accurate forecasting and pipeline management, ensuring visibility for leadership and investors.

  • Partner closely with early customers to understand their needs and influence Vanta’s product roadmap.

  • Continuously evolve Vanta’s sales approach by introducing new tactics and solutions to shorten sales cycles, increase deal sizes, improve win rates, and drive overall revenue growth.

  • Actively contribute to scaling the team through recruiting, onboarding, and training new Account Executives.

  • Foster an inclusive and supportive sales culture aligned with Vanta’s core values.

  • Maintain a strong understanding of industry trends, competitors, and the challenges of scaling startups.

How to be successful in this role:

  • 4+ years of experience selling B2B SaaS to startups and small businesses, with 1–2 years in a leadership or management role.

  • Demonstrated track record of consistently meeting or exceeding sales quotas, both as an individual contributor and as a leader.

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to build trust and credibility with founders and early-stage operators.

  • Proven success in managing fast-paced, competitive sales cycles, often with resource-constrained buyers.

  • Experience building or refining sales processes, playbooks, and teams from the ground up.

  • Technical aptitude to quickly understand and confidently communicate Vanta’s software capabilities.

  • Empathy-driven leadership style focused on consultative value selling, long-term customer success, and team development.

  • A growth-oriented mindset, proactively seeking opportunities for continuous improvement and professional development.

  • Passionate alignment with Vanta’s mission of securing the internet and safeguarding customer data.

What you can expect as a Vantan:

  • Industry-competitive salary and equity

  • Healthcare stipend towards health insurance for you and your dependents

  • 16 weeks paid parental leave for all new parents (birthing, non-birthing, and adoptive)

  • Health & wellness stipend

  • Remote workspace stipend

  • Commuter benefits for team members who attend the office

  • Internet and cellphone stipend

  • 9 company paid holidays

  • 20 days of PTO per year

  • Virtual team building activities, lunch and learns, and other company-wide events!

As the Director of Engineering for Core Platform, you will lead and grow a dynamic engineering organization focused on evolving and scaling the engineering systems & infrastructure that enable Vanta’s developers to create great products - shipping quickly, efficiently, and securely across the entirety of our organization. You will have a pivotal role in driving innovation for Vanta’s engineers, customers and business, scaling high-performing teams, and shaping the technical future of our products.

Visit our Vanta Engineering Blog to learn more about what our team is working on!

Please note we are only able to hire in Alberta, Ontario, and British Columbia.

  • Lead multiple teams to deliver results consistently and sustainably while holding a high bar for execution and quality

  • Proactively identify, define, and lead strategic initiatives - especially in the developer productivity space - that align engineering capabilities with business outcomes.

  • Partner closely with engineers & leaders across Vanta to create foundational building blocks - accelerating product engineering and bringing our vision to market.

  • Guide technical strategy, ensuring that your teams are enabling long-term value aligned with Vanta’s business priorities.

  • Build a high-impact engineering team - coach, mentor, and create an environment where your teams and managers can do their best work and deliver for the business.

  • Play an integral role in influencing and shaping Vanta’s engineering culture and strategy

  • Own and maintain Vanta’s FedRAMP authorization from an engineering perspective, partnering cross-functionally to ensure compliance & evolving our systems to meet customer needs

How to be successful in this role:

  • 8+ years of engineering leadership experience, with deep experience working on complex products and/or their respective platforms in a high growth environment

  • Experience leading & scaling engineering organizations of 35+ in size with multiple teams, and a proven track record of growing high-performing teams beyond this initial size

  • Passion for leading, coaching and building an inspired team through setting vision, unlocking potential, and driving compassionate accountability

  • Business acumen paired with an understanding of applying the unique leverage of platform principles to enable step change innovation & results

  • Strong decision maker who effectively balances ambiguity, available data, speed, and quality

  • Effective communicator and story-teller. Able to influence engineering partners and leadership at all levels

  • Operates at multiple altitudes, from developing vision and strategy to driving execution

At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it.

Design Systems is on a mission to build tooling that empowers internal teams to easily build consistent and high quality user experiences that delight our customers. Ensuring our components meet product needs and keep look and feel consistent, intuitive, and premium for our end customers across a quickly growing engineering org rapidly shipping new capabilities is key to Vanta’s success.

As a Staff Software Engineer at Vanta, you will play a critical role in driving the long-term technical strategy, leading complex initiatives, and making high-impact decisions that affect your product area and the broader engineering organization. You will set the tone for engineering excellence and culture. This role involves a mix of hands-on development, leadership, strategic thinking, and cross-functional collaboration. You will work closely with engineering leadership and product teams to ensure the alignment of systems with Vanta’s technical strategy, and you will actively influence key decisions across the organization.

What you’ll do as a Staff Software Engineer on Design Systems at Vanta:

  • Be a leader for and advise on UI/UX best practices and standards at Vanta bringing a high bar for design craft ensuring our components are both functional and refined

  • Build, maintain, and update existing shared UI components to ensure they are consistent across our system and product, bug free, well tested, and well documented.

  • Educate all engineers in UX and industry standards and best practices, our Design System guidance, and how to implement in code.

  • Support product team use cases through building new shared patterns when it makes sense to extend the system, or updating guidance.

  • Identify, scope, and lead large technical projects that lay the groundwork for building highly performant and reliable systems.

  • Lead key technical decisions that will form the system’s stance and recommendations for product teams.

  • Rally cross-functional teams to drive initiatives to completion, even without direct management of team members.

  • Address product, technical, and operational challenges with clear, impactful solutions.

  • Serve as a cultural leader, modeling collaborative behaviors and mentoring engineers to elevate organizational performance.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Over 9 years of industry experience with deep expertise in one or more technical areas (e.g., frontend, design systems, accessibility, app performance, runtime).

  • Proven ability to lead complex technical initiatives, driving strategic projects and improving organizational processes in fast-paced, dynamic environments.

  • Mastery in system design and software architecture, with an emphasis on user experience and accessibility standards, and a strong sense of design craft.

  • Extensive experience building tooling and abstractions for developers that result in user-facing experiences.

  • Expertise in debugging and supporting platform tooling for the frontend.

  • Strong leadership and mentorship experience, consistently up-leveling teams and leading by example.

  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and advocate for technical decisions at all levels of the organization.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager, Frontend Platform
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

We are seeking an experienced Engineering Manager to lead our Frontend Platform team. This team’s mission is to build tooling for all engineers to easily ship and maintain quality and perforant frontend experiences that are resilient to changing business needs. By focusing on fast web builds, reliable testing, app performance monitoring, and solid versioning and modularity in our codebase, this team helps lay the foundation for all engineers to contribute better code, faster.

In this role, you’ll be focusing on foundational improvements to and technology investments in our frontend tech stack to make all engineers more productive, and our web client more performant. You will also play a key role in shaping the culture of frontend engineering and talent at Vanta.

As an Engineering Manager, you’ll be responsible for setting strategy, leading your team to deliver results consistently and sustainably, growing and developing talented engineers, and cultivating a healthy, results-driven culture on your team to deliver significant value to our customers and enable our business to scale.

Vanta’s business, technology surface, and team are growing—this provides a career-defining opportunity for you to grow as an engineering leader. It’s essential that we accelerate Vanta’s engineering discipline through an innovative developer environment while investing in the right abstractions and systems to enable us to scale to more customers and product lines. You’ll leverage your past experience and play a crucial role in laying the groundwork for a successful engineering organization, contributing to developing foundational processes that enable our entire team, and organization, to scale. Our business has an incredible product-market fit and effectively monetized since the day we signed our first customer.

Visit our Vanta Engineering Blog to learn more about what our team is working on!

Please note we are only able to hire in Alberta, Ontario, and British Columbia.

What you’ll do as an Engineering Manager at Vanta:

  • Manage and mentor a team of engineers focused on developing world-class developer productivity tools and infrastructure.

  • Define and implement strategies for improvements in frontend infrastructure, developer tooling, and release processes to enable rapid innovation while upholding high-security standards.

  • Drive the adoption and integration of tools, services, and APIs built by the team across the codebase.

  • Stay abreast of emerging web and frontend technologies and assess their applicability in streamlining development processes and client performance.

  • Work closely with stakeholders to deeply understand developer and client needs, identifying and implementing solutions that support secure and efficient development.

  • Design and refine processes that enhance team operations and continuously improve developer productivity as the organization scales.

  • Champion best practices for web clients and frontend stacks.

How to be successful in this role:

  • 3+ years of experience managing technical teams of six or more engineers.

  • Proven track record in building and improving frontend infrastructure and tooling for developers.

  • Deep knowledge of modern development practices, developer tooling, and current web best practices and industry standards.

  • Strong leadership abilities with experience in hiring, mentoring, and growing senior engineers.

  • Excellent communication skills to build consensus with stakeholders and articulate the value of frontend infra and developer tools.

  • Experience planning, scoping, and executing on cross-org migrations with an emphasis on limiting migration cost to consumers.

Things that may allow you to standout:

  • Experience leading a frontend or web-specific platform team

  • Experience leading senior and staff level engineers

jobs.title: Backend Senior Software Engineer, Identity
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

Our Senior Software Engineers lead and mentor engineers, delivering high-value products for our customers and infrastructure that enables our business to scale.

Vanta’s product monitors the security posture for thousands of companies, pulling tens of millions of API calls of data per day, pushing information from hundreds of thousands of laptop agents, and running tests against that data continuously to identify potential security threats. Our infrastructure and tooling need to stay ahead of exponential growth in our customer base. As a Senior Software Engineer at Vanta, you’ll be responsible for setting technical direction to provide a strong foundation for our infrastructure to scale with our business. You will also drive complex projects across our technical stack and mentor our talented engineering team. Your past experience will be leveraged to enable and accelerate Vanta’s growth.

Visit our Vanta Engineering Blog to learn more about what our team is working on! 

Please note we are only able to hire in Alberta, Ontario, and British Columbia.

What you’ll do as a Senior Software Engineer on the Identity team at Vanta:

The Identity team at Vanta is building the critical foundation that powers our entire security platform as we scale to serve enterprise customers. Our team focuses on two core pillars: authentication systems that provide secure access to our platform, and authorization frameworks that enable fine-grained permission controls. As we expand upmarket, we're facing interesting challenges that require thoughtful evolution of our identity infrastructure. In this role, you'll help design composable and extensible systems for complex user data modeling, support our evolution toward policy-based authorization, and establish clean interface contracts for identity services. You'll tackle complex challenges at the intersection of security, scalability, and user experience, while influencing how multiple engineering teams integrate with our identity platform. Your work will be fundamental to Vanta's success with enterprise customers, where robust identity management is essential to earning trust with sensitive data.

You will also:

  • Lead complex projects with multiple stakeholders and engineers to enable our business and team to scale

  • Collaborate with Security to ensure Vanta's platform implements best practices for customer data

  • Support design reviews, communicate constraints, and help engineers make the right trade-offs

  • Act as a cultural beacon, setting an example for effective, collaborative engineering and helping mentor junior team members

  • Make effective tradeoffs that consider business priorities, user experience, and a sustainable technical foundation

  • Drive initiatives to increase operational posture and execution quality across the engineering organization

How to be successful in this role:

  • Have at least 8 years of industry experience with backend development

  • Strong knowledge of authentication protocols (OIDC, SAML) and identity federation concepts (SSO), or authorization frameworks (RBAC, policy-based access control)

  • Experience building platform services that scale across multiple teams

  • Strong data modeling skills for systems with complex relationships

  • Experience solving distributed systems challenges around performance and security

  • Success with complex technical migrations that maintain system stability

  • Security-focused mindset and understanding of enterprise security practices

  • Have led technical projects spanning months

  • Work well in environments that value decisive action and getting things done

  • Experience mentoring and collaborating with other engineers

  • Interest in contributing to Vanta's engineering culture as we grow

What you can expect as a Vantan in Canada:

  • Industry-competitive salary and equity

  • 100% covered medical, dental, and vision benefits with dependents coverage

  • Pension contribution

  • 16 weeks fully paid parental leave for all new parents

  • Health & wellness stipend

jobs.title: Senior Deal Desk Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Vanta, our mission is to help businesses earn and prove trust. We believe that security should be monitored and verified continuously, and we empower companies to practice better security and prove it with ease. Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. 

As a Senior Deal Desk Analyst, you’ll join our growing NAMER Deal Desk team as the primary West Coast representative, driving deals to closure while ensuring data integrity and compliance with business policies and revenue recognition standards.

In this high-volume role, you’ll be a key partner to Pre- and Post-Sales teams, providing guidance on business processes, policy adherence, and pricing strategy to ensure deals close efficiently and accurately. You’ll also play a central role in advancing strategic Deal Desk initiatives, shaping the commercial and operational deal flow at Vanta.

As Vanta scales, building a scalable deal review and execution process is critical. You’ll help design processes that can support our rapid revenue growth and enable alignment across Sales, Deal Desk, Finance, GTM Operations, and Legal teams.

What you’ll do as a Senior Deal Desk Analyst at Vanta:

  • Review and evaluate deals for policy alignment, internal compliance, and booking accuracy.

  • Act as a trusted advisor for Sales, working with Legal, GTM Operations, and various other business partners to guide deals towards closure and be able to have strategic conversations about commercial aspects of deals.

  • Assist with all aspects of deal management including: deal approvals, deal configuration/structuring, pricing, and escalation of non-standard requests.

  • Support Finance teams during month end close and audit review cycles to ensure deals are accurately reconciled between systems and statement of record.

  • Educate Sales teams on process changes, policy updates, and Deal Desk best practices to improve deal velocity.

  • Exceptional project management and organizational skills, with a track record of driving initiatives from strategy to execution

Our business has found incredible product-market fit and has monetized effectively since the day we signed our first customer. We’re growing at a blistering pace, which presents career-defining opportunities for engineers to accelerate their growth and to contribute to a rapidly-scaling company.

Visit our Vanta Engineering Blog to learn more about what our team is working on! 

Please note we are only able to hire in Alberta, Ontario, and British Columbia.

The GRC (Governance, Risk and Compliance) organization is the primary org responsible for developing and maintaining Vanta's core product offerings. These teams are at the heart of Vanta moving upmarket to support enterprise customers and build products that enable our customers’ existing security and compliance programs to integrate seamlessly with Vanta, giving them invaluable insights and recommendations to continue to operate, mature and evolve their programs.

As a Staff Software Engineer at Vanta, you will play a critical role in driving the long-term technical strategy, leading complex initiatives, and making high-impact decisions that affect your product area and the broader engineering organization. You will set the tone for engineering excellence and culture. This role involves a mix of hands-on development, leadership, strategic thinking, and cross-functional collaboration. You will work closely with engineering leadership and product teams to ensure the alignment of systems with Vanta’s technical strategy, and you will actively influence key decisions across the organization.

What you’ll do as a Staff Software Engineer at Vanta:

  • Identify, scope, and lead large technical projects, laying the groundwork for building highly performant, reliable, and customizable systems with long-term impact.

  • Drive a portfolio of complex initiatives with a duration spanning multiple quarters, ensuring iterative and sustainable impact across product areas.

  • Rally cross-functional teams to drive initiatives to completion, even without direct management of team members.

  • Make strategic decisions that prioritize long-term success, while influencing Vanta’s technical direction alongside senior engineers and leadership.

  • Champion engineering excellence by continuously improving processes, methodologies, and technical practices across the organization.

  • Guide teams on tough technical decisions, balancing tradeoffs and resolving conflicts.

  • Address product, technical, and operational challenges with clear, impactful solutions.

  • Serve as a cultural leader, modeling collaborative behaviors and mentoring engineers to elevate organizational performance.

How to be successful in this role:

  • Over 10 years of industry experience with deep expertise in one or more technical areas (e.g., frontend, databases, distributed systems, APIs, AI, etc.).

  • Proven ability to lead complex technical initiatives, driving strategic projects and improving organizational processes in fast-paced, dynamic environments.

  • Mastery in system design and software architecture, with a strong ability to balance technical considerations and execution constraints.

  • Extensive experience building user-facing SaaS products, catering to both startup and enterprise users.

  • Expertise in building 0→1 products and solving large-scale challenges, especially in environments that prioritize a bias for action.

  • Strong leadership and mentorship experience, consistently up-leveling teams and leading by example.

  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and advocate for technical decisions at all levels of the organization.

You’ll collaborate closely with customers to deeply understand their needs and mentor a talented engineering team to deliver innovative, scalable solutions.

Our business has found incredible product-market fit and has monetized effectively since the day we signed our first customer. We’re growing at a blistering pace, which presents career-defining opportunities for engineers to accelerate their growth and to contribute to a rapidly-scaling company.

Vanta has a kind and talented team, and while some have prior security experience, many have been successful at Vanta without it. We’d love for you to join us!

Visit our Vanta Engineering Blog to learn more about what our team is working on! 

Please note we are only able to hire in Alberta, Ontario, and British Columbia.

About the Role at Vanta:

As a Senior Software Engineer at Vanta, you’ll be responsible for leading complex, cross-functional projects that may span across teams and systems. Senior Engineers at Vanta have a demonstrated history of leadership—you will define architecture, scope and assign work, align stakeholders, mentor engineers, and ship critical components, and you have a lengthy track record of doing this. You’ll help develop and scale Vanta’s Trust Products, and guide technical growth across the org.

Vanta’s levels are a little different than other tech companies- we often see people with Staff or Principal titles at other organizations with scope that matches our Senior level.

What You’ll Do as a Senior Software Engineer at Vanta

  • Lead initiatives: bring clarity to ambiguity, define product scope, and solve for technical complexity.

  • Work with Product and Design partners to shape technical solutions that meet real customer needs.

  • Define architecture, delegate implementation across multiple engineers, and ensure successful outcomes.

  • Deliver key portions of the project directly while reviewing and unblocking others.

  • Drive knowledge sharing and mentor engineers, including senior engineers

  • Setting long term technical strategy for your team and raise engineering quality bar

How to be successful in this role:

  • Minimum of 7 years of product-side Fullstack experience; there is no maximum, we often hire Senior Engineers who have 7–10+ years baseline of product delivery and tech lead experience

  • Have experience with our stack: Typescript, React, GraphQL

  • Has a track record of successfully led highly ambiguous and complex project where problems and solutions are not well defined, while coordinating groups of engineers and working with cross functional stakeholders

  • Demonstrated ability to operate with autonomy, align product and engineering needs, and land high-quality outcomes.

  • Trusted to lead not just code, but also planning, process, and culture.

  • Mentors across levels at a team-wide scale; a technical role model and coach. Contributes to/leads programs which uplevel the code quality of the team.

If this sounds interesting to you, but you have even more extensive experience as a leader, please consider applying for our Staff Fullstack Engineer role

What you can expect as a Vantan in Canada:
